text: GOT GARLIC?? Don't understand what all the fuss is about on Yelp. Anyone who thinks this place is worth 5 stars , hasn't had REAL food before . Apparently the chef thinks the more garlic you add the better . I like garlic as much a the next guy, however i could not eat the Cesar salad due to the amount of garlic. It's too much when its too spicy to eat due the the high concentration of garlic . The pasta is just ok , def. not worth the price . Especially the fact that this place calls itself OFF the Strip, and still charges the same as much better restaurants ON the strip. I Have lived in the neighborhood since this place opened and this was my first and last time . Not worth the price for the food they serve.
Adding this to one of our regular places here in Vegas.  Beef Wellington was incredible as well as the service.

I always enjoyed the chicken Caesar salad until tonight.  Something has changed.  Cold chicken with a new dressing that was not the same for $16?  SMH?  Was praying the new ownership was the old ownership.  Not pleased.

Our party of 5 ate at Off the Strip on New Year's Eve this year and all of us had phenomenal meals.  Off the Strip has never failed to deliver an amazing meal in all the times we've eaten here, and we've been coming since they opened.  Some of our party had special dietary needs and Billy, the proprietor, didn't hesitate to deviate from his New Year's Eve fixed menu to deliver anything we desired.  The service at Off the Strip has always been 5 Star, and that level of excellence was certainly on display this New Years Eve.  The service and attention paid to guests without a doubt sets Off the Strip apart.

yelp occasionally gets some things right: the rave reviews of off the strip is one of them.  great, sincerely friendly service, tasty food, fantastic cheesecake.  everything i want in a dining out experience, packaged in a comfortable atmosphere, good for a date or just a dinner with friends.  my favorite place to eat out in vegas.

I wasn't expecting too much when arriving at Off The Strip.  I was just looking for something to eat close to home and I remember seeing this place and it getting good reviews on yelp.

Let me tell you I was very impressed with the food and service.  We ordered the Chicken Parm, Eggplant Parm, and the special on the board which was the Chops.  The chops were cooked to perfection which was covered in this great sauce with chunks of mushrooms and bacon.  The Chicken Parm is ridiculous!!!  I mean the chicken could feed a small country its so big. =) Seriously, both the eggpland and chicken had great flavor and a nice crust as they must put it under a broiler for the cheese to get crispy and cheesy.  We also ordered a meatball on the side which was the size of my fist.  i can't wait to go back and try the Lobster Ravoili.  The prices are very reasonable.  great service.  Jack was very helpful with the menu.  cheesecake was good too.  a must go!!!

Went there for the first time to celebrate mi father's in law birthday there was 4 of us total since the moment we walked in we were taking care of our server was very friendly always checking on us and filling our wine glasses and the food was just exquisite! all of us had different dishes and we tried each others dishes and not one of them was short on flavor from now on OFF THE STRIP  has earn a customer for life!

For outstanding food at reasonable prices, Zest can't be beat.  We've been here at least a dozen times and we've always walked out smiling and happy we came.  

The spaghetti with meatball and sausage (humorously known by those in the know as the "Lance Armstrong") pasta with marinara sauce is simply the best pasta dish I've had.  My girlfriend prefers the garbage salad which she said is spectacular.  I also highly recommend Zest's Linguine with white clams.  It's freakin' yummy!  Finally, don't miss the side of spinach.  It's never overcooked and is skillfully seasoned with garlic and olive oil.

Donna, the bartender/waitress, keeps her cool no matter how buried she is and she consistently takes the time to make us feel at home and welcome.  Jesse is great too.  The thing about Zest, is that it has a locals feel (think your favorite pub) with stellar food.  That's a powerful combination!  My only complaint is the bread.  It's consistently hard and somewhat tasteless.  However, overall this is one of my favorite, if not my absolute favorite, restaurants in Las Vegas.  5 stars are well deserved.  We'll keep going back for great dinners.  Nicely done Billy, nicely done!
This place is a very fun place to go.  Try the bacon wrapped asparagus.  Jesse is a fun person to be around,  They have a wide variety of specials every day.

Excellent food, always seem to be able to squeeze in, good service though staff was spread a bit thin on Fri night around 7p. Housemade cheesecake is out of this world...silky and near perfect! The house salad w/vinaigrette is v. good. Some dishes we tried: ravioli in vodka sauce, bacon-wrapped prawn  apps, steak, and "chicken parm you taste so good"...

I recommend this restaurant. We ordered the rib-eye and lobster ravioli dish they were so good best rib-eye I've had in a long time. It was by far better cooked than some restaurants I've been to on the actual strip. The ravioli dish was big too not like some of those dishes that leave you still hungry. . The waitress that waited on us was so so nice. Highly recommend this place.
Made our nights from the moment we walked in with a warm welcoming to the food costumer service and drinks! Love this place!

I've been a fan and a monthly guest at Off the Strip for the past 2 years. Recently however, I find myself wondering "What happened?" The prices went up (Wellington was $27, now $34), the portions went down---BIG TIME. I still eat here, but only because of the quality of the food. 

I really wonder about the management, you walk in...and there are a dozen people cooking 3 entrees...and two bartenders serving nobody.

Spent a few days in Vegas visiting a friend of mine who took me to this place.

Service is friendly, and watching the chef work his magic in the kitchen makes you feel like you're in for something special.

 The waitstaff serves up a nice side of "Brooklyn" with every meal. We had the beef wellington and chicken saltimbocca (I think I butchered the spelling there!), and both were outstanding. 

One of their appetizer specials was scampi stuffed with cream cheese and horseradish, wrapped in bacon and baked in the oven and served with some type of amazing butter sauce. I don't think my heart could take it every day, but it might be worth heading to an early grave for! 

You can certainly head down to the strip and spend way more money, but you'd be hard-pressed to find better-tasting comparable menu items at any price. 

The location is kinda hard to find, but it's no wonder the locals hang out there. Oh, be sure to save some room for the cheesecake!

We were looking for a local place (no chain restaurants please) and saw this on-line and decided to try it.  Having a car in Vegas is great because we had to drive about 9 miles from the center of the Strip to get here, but the drive was easy and SO worth it!  Wonderful service, delicious food and we even got a complimentary piece of great cheesecake  :-)

If you're in Vegas and want a fun, small place with good food at reasonable prices, GO HERE.

The food was so delicious even though I ordered take out. The Caesar salad was dressed perfect and the Rigatoni Alla Vodka was so flavorful and the pasta was cooked al dente just the way I like it. Next time I am going to eat in the restaurant and try out some of the other dishes.

This place is my home away from home. Great food, huge portions and ausome wine pairings. Never been disappionted. It's nice to have a quality restaurant in a sea of fast food and garbage taco shops out in SOHI. If your lucky enough to have Stephenie as your waitress you will no doubt be treaded like family. Happy eating!
Unpretentious mature atmosphere, fresh fast food with accurate menu descriptions and great service .
Wonderful selection of gluten free entrees. Huge menu. Our party had pizza, chicken tacos, and gf spaghetti with a huge meat ball. All very tasty.

New to Las Vegas and tried this gem of a restaurant for the first time. Food was terrific and the service was phenomenal; especially our server Katie! Will definitely  be coming back again and thoroughly recommend.

Great atmosphere that's the first thing you notice when you walk in. Very inviting and friendly staff with a casual and energetic crowd. Most importantly the food is very flavorful and a very filling, with generous portions!
Excellent! We go to Off The Strip/Zest on a regular basis and have never been disappointed. Great service and excellent food. Our favorites include: Chicken Parmesan, calamari, and Caesar salad.

We've been to Off the Strip twice now in the past month, and both times we have had a wonderful experience. Every single item that came out of the kitchen was amazing. We had their calamari and tomato caprese appetizers, and both were gone within minutes. For the main course, my husband ordered their chicken alfredo and I chose the shrimp scampi, both with Caesar salads to start. Everything was phenomenal. The dishes were  both very fresh and seasoned perfectly - no complaints here! After dinner we ordered their famous cheesecake, and it did not disappoint! The wait staff has been great both times we've been in there, very responsive and they always have a positive attitude. The atmosphere is casual, with a few TVs playing behind the bar. 

Honestly, you wouldn't know it from looking at it from the outside (or from the inside either!), but the food here is some of the best I've had in Las Vegas. And the prices are incredibly reasonable for the quality - added bonus!  I'd recommend this to anyone, and will likely be back there again soon.
OUTSTANDING!!!  Pasta is always perfect.  Friendly, Great food, great service.

My wife and I eat hear often and have always had a GREAT meal. Last night she was in the mood for pizza so I suggested Zest. We have never ordered pizza here before and we will never order pizza here again. We ordered chicken pizza with onions on half. It took a very long time for the pizza only to be informed that they put onions on the whole pizza. We accepted it and proceeded to eat. The pizza was cold and the chicken was awful. We sent it back and ordered a cheese pizza. This pizza was hot but the crust was extremely soggy. It was so bad we only ate a slice each and told them to keep the rest. They did the right thing and did not charge us. We will definitely go back but not for the pizza.

We went out to dinner not expecting too much, because in Vegas it just seems like whenever we have high anticipation it's all  disappointments, but  to our surprise, the food was absolutely amazing! Our waitress Nicole was extremely nice and very assertive. We started with an appetizer, rolled ny steak with asparagus inside, tasted great. Then I had a delicious salad with house dressing, like a balsamic base and again, a home run! Then I ordered the rigatoni with marinara sauce and a side of 2 meatballs. I must say itwas the best meatballs I have had since grandma when I was 10 years old. The marinara sauce on the rigatoni was also very good. Then we tried the filet which our friend had which melted like butter in our mouth with a perfect sear to the outside and a perfect medium rare on the inside, cooked to perfection as ordered. Then we had a cheesecake to die for! All in all 5 stars and an awesome dining experience!

I am cautious about giving 5 star reviews but this place warrants it. The service is as good as it gets, great ownership, and the portions are borderline gluttonous. If you do not stop here on your trip to Vegas you will have done yourself a disservice. The food is fantastic!

Delicious and a nice break from eating on the Strip.  I'm not saying it's the best Italian food in Vegas, but for the price I'd guess it's close.

Like many other reviewers we were offered the "around the world" option which involved getting little bites of a bunch of different appetizers -- one of each for each of us.  And it's a great (though not inexpensive) way to try everything.  

Our favorites were the steak and asparagus rolls and the Thai shrimp (stuffed with cheese, wrapped in bacon and served with a sweet and spicy sauce).  We probably could have stopped before the main courses and been happy, but we pressed on.  The salads were tasty, the pasta was perfectly cooked, the meatballs were huge yet tender and meaty, and the cheesecake (on the house for the birthday boys) was light and very good but not the best I've ever had.  Another favorite of ours was the rib eye sliced up for our tasting and served with delicious creamy horseradish sauce -- not very Italian, but really delicious!

On a side note, one of the people in our party doesn't eat beef or pork and her options were a bit limited.  When we asked for a shrimp without the bacon for her they were happy to oblige but it took a long time.

They charge a corkage fee of $20 per bottle, but if you want to order off they menu there were a few good and reasonable choices.

If you have a car, it's worth the drive to try it.  If you're taking a cab, it would probably be a rather expensive ride so you might as well just shell out the extra money on the strip (Rao's is pretty good).

This is one of our favorite restaurants, we've have been several times and the food has always been amazing....... but after last night, we will never be back. 

Our party of four arrived around 6:30 on New Years Eve. We were greeted by who I am assuming is the owner. We asked for a table for 4 and told him we didn't have reservations. We should have been tipped off by his change in attitude as soon as we said we didn't have reservations. 

He disappeared for 5 minutes leaving us in the front of the restaurant right next to a table who was trying to enjoy their dinner. Upon returning he seated another group who didn't have reservations and started telling me he had to be really careful about seating us. I asked about 3 open tables that would have seated our party.......... In my life I have never seen someone go from being calm cool and collected to a raving lunatic so fast. I was speechless and amused by his ranting and arm waving. At the end of his diatribe..... he stated "this isn't going to work out tonight."    

We will never be back, but I'd like to thank him. His outburst provided a nights worth of laughs and without him kicking us out............. We would have never ended up at Bootlegger Bistro, which was amazing.

Pretty disappointed. Been here before and it's been so good. Food was great. Hate when good places go shitty. It's almost like they build the buzz and then hold out and cut back to save money and then rip off loyal customers. Been there recently and the filet mignon was spongy... Tasted like it had been frozen and then thrown on the grill. Gross. My fiancés chicken Parmesan was gross too... Man... Food use to be good! Dear owner bring your game back! And try doing a deep clean... place use to be clean.
This is a great restauarant to eat at  if your are in this area. The pork chops and stuff chicken scampi were both delicous. There was enough room to accomadate us so we ate the bar, which was ok.

What a great treat. My wife and I always look for non chain local favorites and this place is awesome.  Miguel took great care of us and made wonderful recommendations.   I come to Vegas a few times a year and plan on bringing customers to this 5 star establishment..
The best dining experience I've ever had in Vegas, and at very reasonable prices. The chef came by and made recommendations and was great to talk to. A must see.
Love this neighborhood location, food is yummy, service great and attentive, so happy they are doing well.  My fave is the stroganoff.. great drinks too.  Never disappoints...

My wife and I tried this restaurant for her Birthday. Quaint place but loud. The food was the best we had in Las Vegas. The beef Wellington was excellent and the linguini and clams was unbelievable. The service was excellent! And one added bonus was the music.

Don't bother wasting your time to eat here. Over priced, expensive and not tasty. This restaurant used to be named off the strip. But you pay strip prices. Maybe that's why they changed the name because customers were shocked by the high, strip-like prices?! Whatever the reason, it's not worth spending that kind of money for tiny portions.

More great food in vegas!

This place is in Southern highlands.  about 10 min south of Mandalay Bay.

They had a great selection from pasta to seafood to steak and chops.  I got there a little late and gotta say the only complaint was it was a little slow to get the food after we ordered but it really was worth the wait.

We started off with some prawns and chicken wings.  The wings were good with some sort of sweet glaze on em.  They also came with fries.  The prawns were a thai style sauce but wrapped in bacon.  They were really good but only got 2 so i thought for the price you should have gotten at least 3.

The main course I got some chicken wrapped in prosciutto in a Marsala type sauce.  It was great.  Chicken was very moist and the sauce had some mushrooms in which tasted great.  It came with a side of fresh spinach.

I will be here again for sure.  My buddies that go hear a lot said that if there isn't something on the menu you like you can tell them what your in the mood for and they will try to put something together for you.  Its that kind of service and quality of food which will keep this place here for a very long time.

The wait staff was also very friendly and attentive.  He was always trying to give us a update on the meal.

If your a little further south on 15 off the strip, maybe staying at SouthPoint hotel try to check it out.
Best meatballs I have ever had! I am very picky with my meatballs but the quality of the meat and how well they were cooked was amazing!! You will not be disappointed!

Another good find on Yelp! Great and varied menu selections. Very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful staff. Great recommendations and descriptions of the entrees. 
We had and shared the grilled salmon and the pork chops off the "light" menu. 
Both well prepared and tasty. Generous servings. 
Owner on site checking in on the diners. Friendly neighborhood vibe. 
I'll be back next time in town.

Came here for dinner tonight and was pleased with the experience. Happened to arrive during happy hour (which is until 630) and had a lovely glass of Malbec for $5. My boyfriend also was able to get a craft beer for $3. Sat at the bar and the bartender was very attentive and nice. Got the short rib ravioli appetizer which was delicious. I got the spaghetti with a (huge) meatball and my boyfriend got a chicken dish with veggies and mashed potatoes. They also had a nice extra menu of healthier options that we both just happen to have avoided, oops. But a good option nonetheless. Both entrees came with salads, house dressing was a vinaigrette that was pretty tasty. I would recommend this for a good off the strip option.

We were driving back from the M and thought we would try eating here because of all the great reviews. My GF thought it was funny that it was a hole in the wall, in a strip mall, in the middle of nowhere.

 I'm glad we stopped. The service was great. The food was awesome. You can watch your food being prepared. I had the Caesar salad and Chicken Saltimbocca. She had the House Salad and Lobster Ravioli. We were both extremely impressed with every aspect of our meal.

 To top things off, our waiter who had been really great throughout the evening, brings a slice of Strawberry Cheesecake. It was rich, delicious and beautifully presented.

 This was the best deal we got in Vegas.

I'm glad I found this place... too bad there's not one in NY. 

What to expect: It's in a strip mall, off to the side and it's a small space compared to the monstrous chain restaurants in Vegas. There are probably only 18 tables and a 10' long bar area with a couple of flat screens. The service is like that of the neighborhood place in your hometown... they make you feel like you've walked into a place that you've been going to for years. The food is very good. Everything was prepared well... the best way to explain it is that maybe it will remind you of when you went to grandma's house for dinner. The owner is there and stops by to introduce himself... he is very personable and non pretentious. Not a typical Vegas experience, but Vegas didn't impress me very much anyway. This place did.

Probably one of the best, if not the best place to eat in Southern Highlands. The food was great, nice atmosphere but the service was a little slow. . We usually go at least once a week. They have a very good happy hour and a nice bar as well. I would highly recommend this place to anybody and always take family and friends.

Fantastic food and great staff!!! Donna was our server and she was amazing!!! I had the Beef Wellington and it was delicious!!! Even our busser Trent was extremely attentive. Overall a great dining experience

All the staff is friendly and professional, Pauly was our waiter and was great! Warning the chicken parmesan is a monster size portion so be hungry! Thanks guys we will be back! 

Mike & Janine

To be honest I was unable to eat the food and from what I observed it looked good. We found this on yelp and I took my son, his expecting wife (due in two weeks) and 4 year old Granddaughter to dinner on Friday night. When we walked in the manager or owner walked up and said we will have a table for you in five minutes, we are just waiting for a table to leave. 25 minutes later we were still waiting and they were seating people with reservations ahead of us. When I balked the manager confronted me and said I should have had a reservation. Clearly he was right  but he never said anything about that when we walked in and I don't think he should have angrily confronted me when I complained. Don't go here without a reservation. It small and more of a bar than a restaurant.

I come here very often and am yet to be disappointed. Every meal is delicious and well prepared. Great food for half the price you would pay on the strip. They also have a good selection of wine. Family owned and friendly staff.

Wow.. Great food, but awful service. Water was AWEFUL. It actually smelled. The waiter was pissed when we asked him to remove all the water from the table. It was so bad that I submitted a report to the SNHD to request an inspection.  I had to go walk around to find someone to get out waiter to take our order. Food was AWESOME, some of the best I've ever had - but the service and tap water were very poor.  When we were ready to leave, we asked for the check.. waited over 10mins.. then I finally had to go walk to the kitchen to get someone to get us the check. The check was handwritten and had many mistakes. They missed a few drinks that were ordered, but overcharged on some of the food. Overall it worked out in our favor - but make sure to look over the bill !!!! The chefs should go find another place to work at. The service was worse than McDonalds.

overpriced and food is mediocre. overall, service is mediocre to bad depending on the night. drinks are terrible. they either skimp on alcohol or serve any cocktail rather than admit they have no idea how to make the drink that was requested. and of course,they shoot dirty looks & bad attitude at customers who call them on their mistakes to boot.

Love this place, everything is great! Pork Chops, steaks are exceptional. Try their Caesar salad it is great.  Save room for their cheesecake it is amazing and tastes like New York Cheesecake.  My only complaint is the chairs, they are hard and uncomfortable so we hurry through a great dinner because of comfort.

By far my favorite local restaurant in Las Vegas.  I have not had a dish that was not delicious.  So far I have had the shrimp scampi, scampi stuffed chicken, chicken and artichokes, Chef Al's pork chops, beef wellington, really trashy garbage salad, and of course the cheesecake.  All AMAZING!

Maybe I ordered the wrong item...grilled salmon. 
It was just ok - definately not trying that plate again. 
I will say that the one bite I had from hubbys pork chop was.delightful. 
I agree with a lot of other reviews that the decor and atmosphere could improve for the price you're paying per plate.  Service was good and yes we got the free cheesecake which was a nice gesture. We will be trying it again and this time I will order a locals fave. 
P.s the bread does suck!

We have been regulars for over 2 years; when they were called Off the Strip. The food has been very good & consistent. We eat there often enough to know the owner & servers by name. Tonight will be our last. We actually had a meal that was not  good & shared it with the server & owner. Both tried to blame it on the chef & took ZERO responsibility for it. Not even an apology for the bad meal. It's unfortunate that they couldn't handle a small complaint & take it as a way to make their business better. Apparently, they are booming in business & our patronage won't be missed. It's okay, because they are also a dime a dozen. We have many other places that will appreciate our business.

Great Food /Excellent Service! Our waiter James made excellent Wine and Food suggestions. The Salmon over Risito with Lobster Cream Sauce was A++. Ceaser and Bleu Cheese Dressings (homemade) were the best i ever had! Must dining spot off the strip in Vegas and very casual!

Love this place.  Great food and staff.  Nice neighborhood feel.   Cheesecake is great.   Had chicken tristina this visit and it was great.   Also like the garbage salad,  saltimboca, and penne alla vodka.  Visit  every time I'm in Las Vegas.

The smell alone tells you that you picked the right place but thanks to previous reviewers for helping us find this gem.  Our meal was outstanding from start to finish.
I was very impressed by the house salad of mixed greens with a nice and light balsamic dressing...so unlike the run of the mill salad.

For appetizers we had the sweet chili shrimp and the ribs.  If you like your ribs tough and tasteless, then don't order these because they fall off the bone and had a light tangy delicious flavor. The shrimp were very good and the biggest shrimp we had ever been served.

For entrees we had 4 cheese ravioli and the tortellini in a tomato cream sauce.  We lived in the heart of little Italy in Connecticut for many years and these two dishes were comparable to the best Italian restaurants we frequented.  I am a sauce snob and very fussy about my tomato sauce and this one exceeded my expectations.

I have saved the best for last....if you have any liking for rice pudding, you must try this one.  We have renamed it "Beyond Rice Pudding" because it is the best we have ever had...so creamy...like a cross between a tapioca and rice pudding.

And right at the finish line for SUPER desserts is the cheesecake which we took "to go" and had later in our hotel room.  Light, creamy and drizzled lightly with chocolate, strawberries and caramel.

We come to Las Vegas often and we will put this place on our "must do" list....well worth the 15 minute ride from the strip.

Many thanks to a most pleasant waitress, Megan for adding to a very enjoyable experience.

My husband and I wanted to try something new and I am so glad he recommended this place! The food is RIDICULOUS and the service was amazing!!! The restaurant was cozy, laid back and all of the staff made you feel like a regular. 

We will definitely be frequenting this restaurant.

Just went there for valentines day and was it busy, oh boy. Right when we came in we were greeted by the owner of the place. Insanely nice guy. We didnt have a reservation so it was a bit harder to get a table but they pretty much made us our own, was reallh sorry that he had to put us by the door but we didnt mind, we just wanted dinner. The staff is extremely friendly and they attend to you on a regular basis. The owner constantly walks around checking up on things which is a big plus for me. It was very busy so i didnt expect the food to come out very fast and its all made as fresh as possible so its not an instant thing. We ordered the wings first, and i must say that they were honestly the best wings i have ever had at a restaurant. Then i ordered chef Als special pork and she got shrimp pasta something. The pork was to die for. So tender and juicy, you can tell it was freshly made and didnt sit around at all. The food was beyond good and the service and staff were just great. My first time here and many more to come. A little pricey but after you eat the food, every penny is worth it. Amazing restaurant!!

Great dinner tonight!! Our server, Miguel, was awesome and that really adds to the experience! Our stuffed blue cheese olives were hand made and made the vodka martini amazing. Mussels were fabulous and the Salmon Risotto entree was excellent! I love the wedge salad, but a little red onion would take it to the next level. Can't wait to come back....hopefully Miguel will be on duty!!

Food and service were excellent. The owner came to our table to greet us and go over all of the specials.  He was extremely pleasant and the waitress was fantastic!  There were 4 in our party and everybody thoroughly enjoyed their meals.  To end the meal, they brought us a piece of cheesecake, on the house because it was our first time, stating "no one leaves their first time without having a piece of cheesecake".

A great Southern Highlands restaurant with great food and great employees! The salmon is great! The Fettuccine Alfredo is another favorite. A great whiskey selection to top everything off. Weekly food and drink specials!

I came to Zest with my family for my Birthday and I must say, THE BEST FOOD IN VEGAS. Everything was perfect and our server paired our dishes with the right wine. Nicole is very attentive and honestly I would go back just for her. Thank you for making my birthday such a memorable experience you'll definitely see me again.

Read a review about the place and decided that we had to try it. Since we were going to the M resort, we figured it would be a good time to try. It was the best decision we ever made. Even though it is a ways from the strip, it was well worth the trip. The prices were amazing for the quality of the food. 

Never would have imaged from the outside of the place, what we found on the inside. We were extremely surprise. Nice size bar with a large variety of wines along with a number of different beers. 

As far as the food, I order the lobster ravioli and my boyfriend order the chicken saltimbocca both were full favored. Amazed at the quality of the food. After trying these two items, we are definitely planning to come back to this location to try more of the menu. This place could easily be placed inside one of the high end casino/resorts on the strip. The food was that great. We had eaten at a number of the high end restaurants on the strip and feel that this particular place could not only compete with them but would surpass a number of them. 

At the end of the meal, our waiter brought us a complementary slice of the their in-house made cheesecake which was over the top delicious. We were stuffed after the dinner but the cheesecake was to great to not eat the whole piece served. The cheesecake was served with strawberries in a strawberry sauce and some chocolate sauce on the other side of the slice which complemented it very well. 

We most also give extreme remarks to our waiter, Chris who made us feel welcomed and did a wonderful job of serving us. He took extra steps in making sure, we were well taking care of during the whole meal from the time we entered the place until we finished. We could not ask for anything more.

OMG This is absolutely the best food I have had in Vegas ever. Everything I have ever ate there has been a true delight to My taste buds. The service is great and the people are always upbeat and in a very helpful mood. I would say if you haven't eaten there then you need to go and try it.
This place is like something out of a book.   It is a small intimate setting with a terrific staff and wonderful food.  Make sure you try the filet wrapped asparagus.  OMG

One word 3x's: OUTSTANDING OUTSTANDING OUTSTANDING!!!! Thee BEST Horseradish Crusted Salmon and Gnocchi with Alfredo Sauce & Bell peppers EVER!!! Exceptional service and pretty good wine selection. PLEASE save room for their made in-house Classic Cheesecake!! What a treat!!

Jesse never disappoints! Left a credit card at the restaurant and he went out of his way to ensure it was returned. He is always so friendly and the food is delicious as well. 

I will definitely be back!

We came for dinner on a Sunday night and had a great meal.  We started off with the house salad.  It's so nice to eat a simple salad that gives you a clean feeling after you eat it.  That may sound weird but I don't know how else to describe it?!  The bread was good too.  I had a glass of white wine - perfectly chilled and refreshing!  We ordered the much-hyped sweet chili & bacon prawns for an appetizer.  I thought the cream cheese was a weird ingredient, but it turned out to be delicious.  I had Chef Al's Special Pork Chops for my entree.  This was the only disappointment of the night.  I guess I had a vision in my head of what it would look/taste like, but I was totally wrong.  The pork chops were cooked perfectly, but I'm not sure I noticed the papaya extract it was marinated in.  I tend to like thin cut pork chops, and these were pretty thick.  There might have been a little too much breading and soy sauce.  My husband had the Chef Al's Favorite Rigatoni, which we both loved.  We shared a slice of their homemade cheesecake and it was really fabulous!  This was a great restaurant with friendly staff and we'll be back to try other menu items.
Great food every single time, I really like the chicken Parmesan. Been eating here on Sunday's for about 4yrs. Really like the atmosphere. Really cool employees.

First time trying this restaurant, but it won't be our last! Incredibly friendly staff (I think our server was Katie), and the food was terrific! We had the bacon-wrapped stuffed prawns, which were delicious...you've gotta try these! My husband had beef Wellington and I had penne pasta with grilled chicken and vegetables. Both excellent. And in honor of our first visit, the server brought over the homemade cheesecake...mmm... Can't wait to try more items from the menu!

I am in Vegas for a couple of weeks on business. I have been meaning to try this place as I have heard nothing but great things from locals. I know this isn't the original location and is a newer OTS, but it was close to where I am staying. Went in late and hungry. Kept it simple and got the Eggplant Parm and started with a Garbage Salad...that's right, I said garbage salad which is one of their award-winning, must try dishes. Salad was amazing. Don't be frightened by all of the random ingredients...just order and enjoy. The Eggplant Parm was enough for 3 days worth of eating and was incredbly good as well. Service was great, especially considering I was "that guy" coming in late to eat when I know they were probably trying to close the dining room side. My server didn't skip a beat and gave wonderful attention and recommendations. I would like to go back and actually take the time to experience a full blown dinner with friends here. In the meantime, if you just want huge portions of "high end" food without the stuffy atmosphere of most places, go here. You will not be disappointed. 

More to come. Stay healthy and don't forget to Call Your Doctor or Naturopath!
www.CallYourDoctorNow.com
Best place to eat ever!!!! First time in We tried the lobster ravioli and it was delicious. The waiters were really outgoing and sweet, especially Katie! Prices were decent for a large portion.

This place is pretttttyyy pretttttyyy pretttyyy zasty!! I mean good, definitely ment to say good. Had friendly, fast service, there was a nice array of food options on the menu, and the restaurant was clean. I order an old fashion for a cocktail, it wasn't up to the standard I had hoped, but still good. Switched  to straight bourbon after, the heck with all that mixer nonsense. Would go back, give this place a try and zest up your life a bit!

I've been here a few times. The food is great and a cool atmosphere. My only question is why an authentic Italian restaurant is serving a mediocre bread basket with slabs of wrapped butter? Seems low end for the quality of food. How about warm, crusty Italian bread with olive oil and balsamic? Otherwise- great food.

We just had our first experience at Zest Bistro.  Our server Jessie was wonderful and assisted us through the menu, daily specials and some history of the restaurant.  Pleasant staff, great atmosphere and everything we ordered was exceptionally delicious!! 
Our new favorite restaurant!  We have many visitors from the Midwest and Zest Bistro will be the place we recommend.  We have posted the menu near our home phone and we are going back tomorrow to try some more on the menu!  Don't miss this jewel of a restaurant.

Our favorite. We love the food ... we love the staff ... we love the ambiance.  It is a bit on the pricier side but have yet to be disappointed with any of our experiences. To save, try their happy hour ... their sliders are going to be the best you ever tasted!
Just amazing! Can say anything else. Wish these guys took online reservations, I would be there more often. Thanks Billy & Tom

Off the strip is my new spot for rigatoni alla vodka it is just like uncle Tony makes it.. The staff are very nice and the cheese cake is my favorite in town...But I didn't care much for chicken parm. The app's I tried were very good.. So yeah 4 stars all day.

I like this place...I don't love it. Our food was good, not great. The atmosphere is strange. It seems like they want to be upscale, but are clearly in a strip mall and do nothing to hide that fact. The service was great I will say. We had a friendly and attentive waiter that took great care of us. 

The reason for only 3 stars...We had shrimp scampi, gnocchi, and a cheap bottle of wine, and our bill (with tip) was $100! I could have paid $50 a person ON the strip and got great food, not just the decent food we got here. We might be back for the sole reason that it is so close to where we live, but it would definitely not be my first choice.

Everyone here is always so friendly.  We mainly come here to see Donna. She is always the life of the bar.  We have shared many good laughs and stories together.  We love zest and the staff.  Always tell everyone about the great food and ambiance.  Happy cinco de mayo everyone.  Keep up the great food and staff!!

Great food in a very casual, locals-only type way.  Waiter/manager was great, providing food and activity recommendations.  Even gave us a complimentary piece of phenomenal cheesecake.  Will go back next time in Vegas.

Went to Off the Strip due to Yelp reviews. Four friends interested in Las Vegas  for golf, gambling, and some delicious food.  Highly recommend this restaurant. Had the pork chop and had to take 1/2 home.  Salads come with the meals, so that was a nice touch.  
Felt extremely welcomed from the minute we walked in.  The restaurant is not fancy, but clean and we felt ok in our golf clothes.
Went there for just drinks, seemed nice a casual.. I think from the other reviews I'd go back to try the food ??

I went here for the first time last night and was impressed with EVERYTHING about this place. First off- the bartenders are amazing! They really treat you like family here which is a nice change because it's he's to find that here. We ordered the chicken parm with baked ziti and cesar salad which was delicious- there was nothing left on our plates. The sweet owner was in and sent us over some cheesecake which was to die for and hit the spot. I love that this is a place I could come sit down and have a glass of wine at the bar with friends and grab food or I can come with my entire family and kiddos and enjoy some food too. You can't go wrong with this place really whether it's a night out for date night, with the family and kids, or a quick drink! This is going to be my new go-to place. The bartenders are so nice and will make sure you're getting good service and joke around with :)

I sat at the bar which was a horrible mistake. The bartender was more worried about talking to her friend then serving me. The food was terrible. I really don't know how it has such good reviews. Who knows maybe I just ordered the wrong thing with the wrong staff member.

Used to love this place. Chicken parm to die for. Now - not so much. Mushy breading. Ick!  First serving of bread could've been croutons. Second serving?  Ice cold. Who's checking service here?  3rd serving - warm and soggy. Geez!  

I think it's time to find somewhere new. Sad. Truly sad.

Amazing food and excellent service! Went there with a party of 4, was immediately seated, the waitress was amazing! She was even able to suggest different popular dishes and she gave us free cheesecake for dessert. The fillet mignon was to die for, the pasta dishes were equally as amazing and that carmel cheesecake was not a disappointment!. They also have a very unique bar that just adds to their decor.
Excellent customer service, they never disappoint! The food is excellent, I wish more places were like this! Everyone who works here provides top notch service!!

Really tasty food. Service is a bit slow and a bit unprofessional, but the delicious food makes it worth it.

Ordered the lamb chops, chef al's rigatoni, and the chicken saltimbucco. All fantastic. Would come again!

Do you have a place that knows your name, knows  what you like, treats you well and gives service with a smile? Zest is the best! I've been coming here for dinner, for drinks more times then I'd like to admit! Most recently took my family from Australia and Canada to their Sunday brunch! EVERYONE loved the food! Thank you to Donna, Jesse, Stephanie, Nicole, Yanni, and Billy for making us feel like family! Don't forget to try the cheesecake:)

I was in town visiting family in Southern Highlands.  We ended up trying a place close to the house "Off the Strip". We were greeted with a big smile and italian accent from Filipo as we walked in. There was great music playing in the background, and you could see right into the kitchen where the chef was cooking. You could smell all the aromas which was a nice change from what your use to in most restaurants. Filipo kept the wine flowing as well as the stories, he was most attentive.  My beef wellington was outta this world and for 25 bucks can't be beat. I recommend anybody going to las vegas to give this place a try!

The food had a lot of potential but fell short due to simple over/under seasoning. The Caesar salad was bland. The potatoes that came with my chicken saltimbocca was amazing. The Marsala sauce for my entree was way too salty and the veggies that came  with the entree were not seasoned at all. I would consider going back if the vents above where I was sitting were clean. I uploaded a photo so you can see for yourself. That dust was falling into the food I was eating...and if they can't keep the area that guests see clean, what's it look like in areas that I can't see?

We dined here on September 17, 2009 on a recommendation from a family member. Let me tell you, as soon as you enter the door you are quickly acknowledged, seated, and welcomed. So many other restaurants acknowledge you as if just going through the motions, but not here. Here they welcome you with a smile and treat you like a friend or family member. 

On the suggestion or our server, he recommended a assortment of appetizers, which I thought would be listed on the menu. Not so, he ordered us a handful of appetizers off the menu, four to be exact. So here's a list of what we had in regards to appetizers. 

1. Beef wrapped asparagus- great presentation, succulent and tender beef wrapped around a stalk of asparagus, with a mouth watering sauce that left me wanting more. 

2. Bacon wrapped shrimp with a sweet chili sauce- Now this was done right, the shrimp was moist and tender and the bacon cooked to perfection, the goat cheese added a a delicate touch and the right combination to compliment the shrimp and the bacon. The chili sauce had enough "wow factor" not to destroy or overpower the dish. I considered it my favorite appetizer and will be ordering another round next week when I visit. 

3. Crab cakes- What can I say? I love crab cakes, this was done well. The sauce sealed the deal, we were seriously contemplating ordering another one, but decided not to, as to give our palettes a crack at trying other dishes. 

4. I honestly can't recollect what we ate, but I think it had artichokes in it and I thought it would make a great bruschetta. Sorry, my memory failed me on this one. 

We then shared a ceaser salad that came with it's own homemade croutons. They were kind enough to split the salad among the two of us. I thought it was okay, pretty standard. 

I ordered the vodka penne as my entree and let me tell you, it was WONDERFUL!!!! 
The sauce was perfect, and complimented the penne quite wonderfully. They really know how to cook pasta, al dente (most restaurants 95% of the time overcook pasta)........... My husbands not a big fan of pasta, but let's just say he reconsidered after having a taste of my dish. 

My husband ordered the panko crusted pork chops with a Asian sauce and assorted veggies. We really enjoyed the tender and moist pork chops, you didn't have to cut it with a knife, that's how tender it was. However, I felt that the dish fell short. I probably would have preferred them coating the pork chop with panko (Japanese breadcrumbs), then frying, letting it sit, then slice and plate it. Then serving the sauce on the side, to accompany the chops. 

Heck, they can even be a little more creative and serve an array of sauces; such as aioli, pesto, or spicy ketchup. I felt like the sauce (sweet and sour) made the panko rather soggy, which wasn't that appealing to our taste buds and did nothing to enhance the porkchop. 

I was quite full by this point,  so pace yourself as you're eating as it's not a sin to take home leftovers (which we did). Even by being full, it didn't stop me or my husband from dessert. 
Let me tell  you, you just have to , I mean really have to, try their homemade cheesecake, made from top notch ingredients and get this, they don't use a mixer to concoct this together. One bite and you'll be hooked for sure, as we both were. The cheesecake was creamy and smooth and not to mention rich, a winner in my book. Just gives us a reason to go back and try the other thing's on their menu. 

The decor is simple and inviting with simple tables and chairs. The kitchen is set us so you can observe the staff in action. There is a bar with a couple of television screens that were set on sport channels. Yes, guy's it's a great place to impress your date and you get a chance to check out the sports scores (just make sure you keep more focused on your date as opposed to the television). 

Overall, the quality of the food for the most part is excellent, they really have a passion for what they do. Bring a big appetite, because portions here, were more than fair; if not bring in a reuseable container because you're probably going home with leftovers, especially if you had a couple of appetizers pre-entree. This place was moderately priced, the service was above and beyond what you're normally used to. Don't be surprised if one of the owners comes up to chat with you, as Tom and Al did with us. 

I would recommend making dinner reservations ahead of time, as it's gets busy during the dinner rush hour. 

With that said, we'll be back soon!!! 

Aloha till next time!

Great food and service.  Rolled New York and the chicken wings were great. Bacon wrapped prawns were good but prefer it without the bacon. Fettuccine Alfredo was very good too. Definitely recommend and will like to return next time I'm in Vegas. Just a bit of drive outside of the strip.

Really.
I've been in Vegas for 4 days. I've eaten at both Nine (at the Palms Hotel)  and the Palm (Caesars)  in the last 3 days. 2 'steak houses' that supposedly serve Prime Beef. No, not really. At over $50 for a steak, that just cannot be true. Prime beef shouldn't be this tough. And to miss a temperature in it's preparation is just criminal.  My room service steak from MGM Grand was way better.

Ok, so it's not for everybody. The service is a little bit different than most people are used to. To me, that is what sets Off the Strip apart from anything else. Everybody in the building will bend over backwards to help you out. 

The food is the best I've had on my trip, end of subject. So good, I'm going back tomorrow night as the ending of my trip.  The wine choices are outstanding. You're not going to find a Chateau Margaux here. You will not be disappointed with the offerings. 

They take care of you like family. The food is outstanding and you cannot beat it for the price. In comparison to Strip pricing, Off the Strip is just in a category by itself.

Got a to-go order. Caprese salad was around $12 - 3 slices of cheese and 3 slices of tomato, average flavor, nothing special. Salmon with asparagus was around $20 - very small piece of salmon and only 2 pieces of asparagus; quality flavor on the fish but it was about 3 bites. Basically, the two dishes I ordered were way over priced for what they included. I like to feel full after a meal, and I'm not exactly an all you can eat glutton.

My husband wanted to try beef wellington and this was a great place to go for this first time experience!  Not only was the food delicious and the service great,  but this place was a lot more inexpensive than everywhere else for the same quality of food. 

Our server, Rita, was the best! She even hooked us up with a free piece of cheesecake at the end of our meal.  And what a delicious ending it was!

The salad was crisp & fresh,  the mashed potatoes were exquisite and the French pork chops were all tasty. My husband enjoyed his wellington.  

Don't let the fact that it's off the strip in a strip mall keep you from trying this hidden gem!

Zest is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. My family and I go there almost once a week. Everything that I have tried on their menu is to die for. I have tried almost everything and have never had a bad meal. Great service as well.

I went to this place to try somewhere different, as had found excellent reviews on another site.  It was quite a trip for us, but overall, well worth it.  

It is situated in a newer strip mall, nothing fancy but not old and dirty either.  It has a pretty open layout, and you can see right into the kitchen from the dining area, which is nice.  The place is extremely clean, nicely decorated, and has at least 3 flat screen TV's.  It is very noisy inside with the TV's blasting out sports, a somewhat cramped dining area, and the din of the kitchen.  This is not the place for a quiet romantic dinner, but a good place to take friends and people who like watching the game while they eat.

We didn't call ahead or make reservations, but it seems that is a good idea because they can be very busy.  Even though we didn't make reservations, the owner, Tom, was able to seat the four of us at the last open table right away.  He also introduced us to his brother, who was serving tables and was obviously a Lakers fan, he was wearing a sleeveless jersey, and had the Celtics - Lakers game at full blast.  I don't mind the casualness, but seeing a guy's pits while he's serving food is pretty gross (one star knocked off for that), luckily he wasn't serving our table. 

Our server was very friendly, but didn't make any recommendations.  Our party of four started with the unadvertised "Around the World", where you get to sample different appetizers for about as long as you like.  I only knew about the Around the World from reading other reviews.  We had the grilled artichoke hearts, Rolled NY - thin NY steak wrapped around asparagus and provolone, sweet chile & bacon prawns - my favorite, and pesto garlic bread.   

For our entrees we ordered the Chicken & Artichokes, Chicken Saltimbocca, Spaghetti Squash and Chef Al's Special Pork Chops.  I also ordered an entree of Chicken Fettuccine to go for the kid at home.  We got house salads with all of them.  The balsamic vinaigrette had a touch of honey in it, and was excellent.  The entree portion sizes were decent for all of the entrees, except the serving with the Pork Chops was huge!  Two very large chops, enough for two or three people.   Luckily my daughter's boyfriend has a hollow leg, and finished the entire plate by himself.   All in all, everyone raved about their dishes. I also expected to receive Chef Al's Potato Pie with my order, but instead got roasted potatoes.  When I asked Tom about it, he said he had too many complaints about the Potato Pie (being unhealthy) and was taking them off the menu.  He whipped up a special plate of them for us.  They were delicious:  mashed potatoes, with cheese and Prosciutto mixed in.  Awesome stuff, it would be a shame if he took them off the menu.  As an extra treat, during our meal Tom's brother made an appetizer of garlic bread, pesto, grilled peppers, onions, garlic and provolone and grilled it to a crisp.  He made enough for the entire house and went around giving them to everyone for free.  Now how often does that happen?  

The only "mistake" made during the night was that our server switched me from Pinot Grigio to Sauvignon Blanc.  But, she left me the extra half glass that was left over, so I wasn't complaining.  We were also treated to a slice of cheesecake to share, and by that point in the night, that's all I had room for.

Our tab, not including taxes or tip, came to $214. 

PROS: Superb food, super friendly owners and staff who treat you like a friend
CONS: noisy, maybe a little bit too casual at times

OMFG.Best of the best in VEGAS. On Zagat scale 27! It is in an unassuming location waaaay off the strip.The place itself is casual looking with TVs playing sports and 70's and 80's music playing. The waiters we really friendly and very attentive.Everyone was so pleasant and seem like they love working here. The menu is onblackboards, but as a 1st timer they recomended the "around the world" tasting menu. Totally the way to go! Got to taste so many dishes, and each one was better than the last.
Yummyyummyyummy. Coming back asap.

OMG!  You've gotta try this place!  Food was FANTASTIC!  It's been a long time since I've been able to say that about any restaurant!  Let's get down to the nitty gritty as we all ate family style:

Tomatio Bacon Bean soup:  Just the name of it made me try it.  OMG!  Delicious!!  I was expecting a small cup, and they gave me a bowl that could've fed 3 people!

Beef Stroganoff:  Cooked perfect and they used wheat pasta. Taste wasn't too strong, nor too subtle.  Excellent!

Spaghetti with two meatballs (each the size of a baseball) and sausage:  Very apparent this was prepared fresh!  The meatballs were tender, and evenly cooked through the middle.  

Chicken with mushroom / artichoke sauce:  I wasn't a fan to begin with, but it was cooked perfect as the chicken was tender / juicy.

Cheescake desert:  Like we could've past up their sweets menu.  Exquisite!

PORTIONS were plentiful!  PRICE was reasonable given the quality, diverse menu selection, and proportions.

It's off the beaten path in a shopping center.  Parking was okay.  The place was packed, but we lucked out and got a table.  Service was decent (not great, but not awful), but they were busy.  Food took a little longer than anticipated (we were going to a show afterwards), but you can't rush the quality (fresh fresh fresh prepared).

They have a bar off to one side, and a few televisions so I got to watch UFC while eating.  I know, it's a dude thing.  

I WOULD CERTAINLY RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT.

This is always a favorite local spot for us and we truly love the food. Great quality dishes with amazing flavor. We have always had good friendly service at this restaurant but it saddens me that our last visit left us not wanting to return. Our experience started off warm and friendly and we enjoyed our dishes as usual but 2 specific incidents regarding our service were quite disturbing. 

We discovered one of the martini glasses we were sipping out of was chipped in 2 places on the rim. When we told our bartender about it she didn't offer to exchange the glass or make a new drink, which would be the standard response in any establishment. She instead informed us she was trying to save on glasses and she would try to give another glass once my partner finished drinking that one in the chipped glass and she brushed it off as if we were to just deal with it. We insisted that she change it out for any other glass at this point due to the potential health risk.

When it came time to pay our bill it arrived 20 minutes after we asked. Once it finally arrived we waited another 25 minutes with no interaction from her. We decided to inquire again about paying our bill as we were under the impression she just forgot about us by this point as she continually passed us by. She finally took the bill and another 15 minutes went by with no interaction when we finally again inquired about our bill and she lost her temper on us stating that the machine was not responding and she wasn't only bar tending she was also serving food at the bar and she was very busy and had many other things to do besides take care of our check. Maybe she just assumed we had the time to sit there and wait over 50 minutes while she tending to the 2 other couples at the bar. Her tone was really condescending and rude.

That being said we have been to this restaurant numerous other times when it was much busier and the service was always timely and friendly so maybe she was just having a bad night. 

Neither of these situations are really a big deal if handled respectfully and with some industry standard communication to the customers.  Simple responses like "sorry about the glass let me exchange that for you right away" and "sorry about the wait and thank you for your patience" would have done just fine.

I don't enjoy going out for a nice dinner in the evening where I feel I am inconveniencing or bothering the staff and especially don't appreciate being ignored and then spoken to in a rude manner with no regard for our time so unfortunately we won't be returning to this establishment.

Amazing food and venue ! The ambiance is perfect for a date night but casual enough to just sit at the bar grab drinks and watch a game. Service is perfect and efficient. Food is always amazing . Everything from salmon to pizzas ! Highly recommend this spot. Have never been disappointed.

The food and atmosphere was great.  Jessie the waiter was very attentive and entertaining.  He had jokes for days, which made us feel like we had our own personal comedian.  He is probably one of the best host I ever came across.  

We  ordered the spaghetti with meatballs, chicken fettuccine, stuffed chicken scampi, fried shrimp tempura, truffle Mac and cheese and a seasonal special consisting of the scallops and pasta.  

Overall the food there was pretty good, but the service (Jessie) made it way better.  We mentioned it was our first time here.  He gave us a complimentary cheesecake at the end for dessert.  

The restaurant has a "bar" like atmosphere, it's kids friendly, has good food and excellent service.  Would recommend this place for Italian food.

This place is as legit as I've ever been in, and I've been to the best.  This is a ma and pa that runs like my Mercedes.  Very smooth service, cordial staff and most importantly, the food is a freaking 10!
Just left zest, so happy I came across this gem! Delicious and good quality everything. Fantastic service, will definitely be back. Thank u! Every barstraurant should be like this! Deliciouso!

First time here for Sunday brunch celebrating a friends birthday. Donna was working, great attitude as well as great service. There were 4 of us, two of us ordered the breakfast sandwich, the other two steak & eggs. All of our dishes tasted great! A good time was had by all. Great service & food. Highly recommend

This place is in a shopping center. It's very obscure, so the only way you would find out about it is through a friend or word of mouth. 
the pastas are amazing. You can't go wrong. The menu is very simple written on a chalk board. It's mostly pastas, but there are some chicken and fish dishes. 
I believe they also have more casual food like subs. 
The homemade cheesecake is definitely worth trying. It's not too sweet, very creamy and crumbly. Goes great with coffee. 
The environment is casual, dimly lit, good place overall for a scrumptious meal.

I can honestly say I'm baffled as to why this place has such great reviews.  I honestly thought that I was in the wrong place at first.

We decided to go to dinner here based off of the reviews and boy were we disappointed.  We were barely greeted by the host/waitress and told to just pick a table wherever we wanted.  We waited several minutes for someone to come with a menu, and when they did they just dropped them off and didn't say anything.  While reviewing the menu, they brought us some water and asked if we were ready.  We decided to order the Rolled New York (because of all the rave reviews) and Rigatoni alla Vodka. 

We were basically the only people in the restaurant and the food still took forever.  The brought us bread with our drinks, and this was probably the saving grace of the entire meal.  When our food finally arrived, I was severely underwhelmed by how bland the Rigatoni alla Vodka was.  For what the sauce lacked in flavor, they seemed to try and compensate it with black pepper.  To top it off, it was way overpriced and not worth it one bit.  Every bite felt like I was eating a forkful of pepper...horrible.  The Rolled New York was nothing to write home about and the steak part was overdone.

The atmosphere was very casual and I could see why families and big groups would like coming here, as they wouldn't have to worry about behaving kids or loud conversation.  

Needless to say, we probably won't be returning here for another meal.  Service was subpar, as was the food.

Wonderful service. The bartender makes you feel like family, very warm and friendly-not a regular here but definitely feel like one when I come in. Great wine selection. Delicious food and wonderful for kids. Happy hour selection is great too

I'm a regular at Zest and I also do Uber Eats a lot from Zest. Tonight I ordered 4-sliders, 2-Chicken FINGERS, 1-Cheese Pizza and 1-Spinach Artichoke Flatbread Pizza. My complaint is that I got Chicken TENDERS. On their menu they have Chicken FINGERS (which is made with Panko Bread crumbs and they're so juicy and made perfect)! AND then they have Chicken TENDERS which is that frozen stuff and very hard. TONIGHT I got TENDERS.....I was bummed! Please Zest let your cooks know the difference or just take the tenders off your menu completely. Over all I'm always satisfied and happy with my food from Zest.

We just enjoyed a fantastic meal at Off the Strip.  Would we go back?  By all means.  Be sure to try the mussels.  They come six to an order and it was perfect as they are quite rich, but absolutely delicious.  I also had the garbage salad, which was great, but a little too much dressing.  Some would like it heavly dressed, but I like to taste all the ingredients instead of just dressing.  My husband had the scampi which was fantasic.  Be sure to save room for the cheesecake.  It's probably the best I have had next to the special cake my brother-in-law makes.  

It was a fun, relaxing experience and it was nice to be able to wear shorts and be really casual and still enjoy a super meal.

the place has to be the best restaurant we went to with reasonable prices, great service and great food. you can tell it is a locals favorite. The asparagus wrapped in NY steak and the chicken tenders were fantastic.  Matt the manager came and checked on us and we had a great conversation. Alll the staff was friendly and quick. Cant wait to come back and try the beef stragonoff!.

We came here for brunch. It was amazing! The hollandaise sauce on the Benedict is to die for! James was our waiter and he was so professional, friendly and helpful. They have all you can eat for brunch or you can just order an item al la carte. The ambience is fun and trendy. The quality of food was superb. Our bill wasn't much more than rise n shine but the service, food and experience were sooooo much better! We will definitely be back!

My wife had been wanting some beef Wellington for a long time but we had a tight budget on this trip and it put Ramsey out of our price range. Reading the reviews for OTSB I knew not to expect much in terms of appearance and it lived up to my expectations, but the food and service more than makes up for it. My wife had a Margarita and it was really good, fresh ingredients make the difference. The Wellington was excellent! Melt in your mouth savory goodness. My son had the fettuccine (wich I had to get a little sample of) and it was cheesy creamy goodness. The quality of the food shows they take pride in there work. A definite dining stop next time we're in town. Ohh and the cheesecake! You have to have cheesecake... Thank you OTSB, it was a great experience. Excellent quality food!

Went in on christmas eve after seeing a show on the strip. As I walked in with 3 other people I heard the manager or owner (older blonde lady) say "Ohh  Come ON! in a frustrated tone like you gotta be kidding me, while she is standing in the kitchen and approached us and told us that they were closing at 9pm in rude tone, they had people eating inside and no sign stating that they were closing early. That's why we walked in. She clearly has no kind of customer service and said "oh Come ON! so loud that my boyfriend and I heard it across the room.  We have been coming to place a few times and now we won't be giving them anymore business!
Love this place. Great food and atmosphere. Will be back again soon.

If you're tired of the Vegas buffets but want somewhere casual but good, this is it. It's a little out of the way but not too out of the way on the way into or out of LV. 

First off, the service and attentiveness were awesome. Our waitress was super friendly and happily answered all our (wife's) questions. Tom, owner, stopped by several times to check how we were doing. And . . because it was our first visit, they gave us a free cheesecake dessert, which was one of the best I've had and despite being a busy Friday night. 

As for the food, it was as advertised. We tried the beef wrapped asparagus, pork roulade, crab cake, NZ lamb chops and pasta w/ bolognese. Our favorite was the crab cake, which was mostly crab and a little breading. Not a pasta guy, I had the lamb chops which came in a very generous portion and was cooked just as ordered - medium. 

Overall, we enjoyed our visit and will put Off the Strip on our list for future visits.

My boyfriend & i live near by & decided why not give this place a try best decision ever! The bartender immediately gave us water without us asking & asked if we wanted bread & butter while deciding what to order. I ended up ordering the Lobster ravioli with a house salad & my boyfriend ordered the Scampi stuffed chicken breast with the house salad. We both thought both dishes & salads were amazing! Donna was super friendly & always checked on us to see if we were okay & happy with our food. She let us try the potato pie that they serve with steaks which was also amazing. She then gave us NY style cheesecake to take home. We decided before we even left Zest that we were coming back.

I come here all the time and it's primarily just to pick up a takeout order. Everything we get is always good, always on time and the staff is awesome. I too have a small business and for what they're doing, I wouldn't do it any other way.  If you live in Southern Highlands it's definitely going to be your favorite go to spot for good food.  (Or carry out)!  These guys rock...!  Thanks for all the great experiences OTS!
Jesse is a half step better than his brother Chris....so excellent. Great food. By far the best restaurant in the south valley.

We had a great time! The food was amazing and the atmosphere was awesome! Our server Stephanie was SO much fun! I love that she took time to chat with us and give us her recommendations! We had the surf and turf which was a delicious ribeye and scallops and the chicken picatta, which was SO good! Don't even get me started on the cheesecake... It was mouthwatering and scrumptious! We will definitely be back!!!

I had a REALLY hard time deciding between 3 and 4 stars, but I went with 3, and this is why.  I've been here twice, and both times the food was great and the service was attentive.  The staff the second time around was much more friendly, with several different people checking on us, even though they were crowded and very busy.  The first time I went there though, it was just my 11 year old daughter and me.  The distaste displayed by the waiter that I had brought a (very well behaved and mature) child in there was obvious and very strange to me. Even more so because the second time I ate there (with adults only) there was a little girl, maybe about 6 years old, running around the restaurant and in the kitchen.  Bizarre.  I wasn't offended.  Some people just don't like kids.  But I did find it odd.  I know they usually bring free dessert if it's your first time there, and I heard it offered to the tables around us, but it seemed that our waiter was trying to rush us out.  HOWEVER, he was attentive, if not friendly, and the food was good.  Location is perfect, so if we don't feel like sushi or tapas, we'll probably be back.  Especially if it's just adults, to sit at the bar during Happy Hour.

Loved it!! 

Food was excellent!! I got the Steak Kabobs with a house salad and BF got the Protein and Veggie Penne. We were both very pleased with our dishes 

Service was great. 
Definitely will be coming back.

They must have changed the name b/c it's definatly not "strip quality" food for "off the strip" prices, way over priced for very mediocre food. Went once before & thought to give another try... Same result! Second time/last time to eat there.
Their food here is amazing. A cute date night spot in Southern Highlands, but don't leave without getting the cheesecake!
Amazing food and even better service. Lucky to have this place right down the street.
Great food, great service! Ba must visit when in Vegas!  Save room for the homemade cheese cake!
A bit of a drive from the Strip (GPS helps!) and set in a strip mall, this placeis certainly worth the drive.  Great food without the glitz of the strip.

I'm new to the area and had to try out the conveniently located Zest Bistro. I was greeted by Donna and experienced an awesome meal. I tried out the fettuccine Alfredo with added chicken and Caesar salad, which were both great. Donna also hooked it up with a cheesecake to take home since it was my first time coming in. I will definitely be coming back in the near future.
A true gem in the area, it's worth visiting for their Beef Wellington alone. Now they have a strip location which sounds a bit odd... :)

AMAZING Food and Staff!  So impressed with our first visit here.  Nnocci Ragu with sausage was delicious.  My husband had the kabobs and raved about them.  Everything is made fresh.  The bread and butter, Caesar salad was so good.  I had a cold and Nicole was our server, she brought me a bowl of the lentil soup and it tasted so good.  She was so sweet.  On the house cheesecake was a real treat and it came with three sauces, thank you!  We met the owner Billy who came over to our table to meet us.  He should be proud of his business.  We were immediately greeted by friendly faces when we walked in and seated immediately.  Would highly recommend this place.  Five stars from us!  We will surely be back!
I have ordered from here multiple times, its always good high quality food , the restaurant itself is a nice  little informal place that fits well into the neighborhood. Friendly staff, good parking.

I have been going to Off the Strip for two years now and today is the day I'm writing a review.

 This place is amazing not only in food but in service.  This place always remembers me every time I come here (Rita the best waitress by the way). Now on to the food, I've had the filet minon and its spectacular from the first bite to the last its like an orgasm with every bite its that good.

The second dish I had was something I've never heard of,  Scampi Stuffed Chicken wow is all I have to say. Its a chicken breast stuffed with shrimp served over noodles. Mouth watering right. 

And finally the Beef Wellington I never had a BW before it was soo good it tasted different with every bite and Rita my awesome waitress told that its better than Gordon Ramsay BW. I believe it. 

This is my favorite restaurant and I love I hope many people go its worth every cent you pay and I will be back. 

Oh and this is how badass this place is on my birthday they gave me a free cheesecake with a candle in it.

Excellent service and delicious food! We got the sautéed pork chops with lemon, chicken parmesan, shrimp scampi, and linguine with clams. Be forewarned: the Caesar salad is heavy on the garlic, but we loved it! Everything was cooked to perfection, and the waitress was extremely friendly and attentive. We told her we are visiting from NY and she gave us a slice of their NY cheesecake on the house. (I was planning on ordering to begin with, but shhh.) I almost wish I didn't have to leave Vegas, just so I could get another taste of Off The Strip! 

I would definitely recommend if you are looking for a delicious meal that won't break the bank!

Love this place! I came here with my husband and some friends because we didn't want to deal with the business of the strip after just getting into town and we were pleasantly surprised. The staff was amazing, Katie, our waitress was so sweet and took the time to know us. She constantly came by asking if we needed anything and our bus boy was on top of removing plates out of our way and refilling our drinks. The food was delicious! We will definitely be back, thank you for making our experience so great!!
Food and service is excellent....Love the chicken bites!  The pizza menu is awesome too...

My favorite local restaurant 

I live in southern highlands and between Zest and the M thy are the best places in the area

Incredible hidden gem!!   Happened to be there on Lasagna night.  Sat at the Bar.  Donna explained went over specials and mentioned new Pizza offerings.
Get the Margarita with Gran Marnier floater!
Lssagna was some of the best I've ever had. 
I'll definitely be back for the Stromboli!
AND DONNA.

As I was new to this area, I wanted to try this place since I had heard so many positive things about it.

When you first walk in, the place looks small.  You have a great view of the kitchen (not one of the positives, in my opinion).  Also, the food menu is listed on chalk boards above the kitchen, which is fine, unless you want to know the ingredients.  They do have regular menus, but it appears we had to ask for one, as opposed to being offered one. We were personally served by the owner, whom was very friendly and charismatic.  He suggested we do "around the world," which was tapas-style eating with their appetizer menu.  We had originally ordered the crab cakes, sweet chili & bacon prawns (prawns w/ cream cheese, bacon, sweet chili sauce), and rolled New York (thin NY strip steak wrapped around grilled asparagus and provolone); however, we were soon informed that they had ran out of crab cakes, so we switched for the artichoke hearts.  He also offered us the scallops, the daily special, on a complimentary basis. We also shared half orders of house and Caesar salads and a half order of the Chef Al's Favorite Rigatoni.  The owner then also offered us a piece of cheesecake and dessert drinks free of charge to end our evening.

All of the food was amazing - everything was flavorful and also unique.  My favorite appetizer was the sweet chili & bacon prawns.  The sweet chili sauce was unlike anything I had ever had before.  Of course, anything with bacon also gets high ratings in my book.  The rolled New York was also interesting since I had never heard of rolled steak, but it was a good alternative to ordering a full steak (which they had available as well).  The salads were also flavorful - tasty dressings - and the pasta was amazing.  The fried zucchini garnishes and garlic cloves definitely made the dish.  Also, the cheesecake was extremely flavorful, better than cheesecake at Cheesecake Factory in my opinion.

I was extremely impressed with the customer service.  The owner offered great suggestions and I was grateful for the complimentary items.  I will definitely be visiting this place again!

It also offers takeout and apparently there is another location on West Tropicana.  You can also sign up to receive special offers via email or text, which (according to the owner) includes specials such as free bottles of wines, free dinners for 4, etc.

We already love dinner here. We decided to try their brunch buffet and it was simply amazing. We had the Signature and was able to try almost everything on it. Homemade biscuits with sausage, burger with bacon, eggs and gravy!!! The Apple waffle, the strawberry shortcake French toast, the Sriracha wings, (nice and crispy) oh my goodness! The kids loved their menu as well. Pineapple mimosa was my favorite!! If you haven't been, you have to try it. Ask for James. He'll take great care of you!

Finally found a decent place to eat with good atmosphere, service and food.  They serve fresh warm bread.  Miguel has served us on several visits and is always attentive and very pleasant.  Tonight I had the spaghetti and meatballs and loved it.  Great meatball.  My wife had the asparagus wrap in New York thin steak and said it was her favorite on the menu.  Thank you Miguel and Zach for the great service tonight.

Zest has to be far our favorite place to dine.  Donna and crew are simply amazing.  The food is always spot on.  Tonight was a tough night it was our anniversary.  So we ended up having everything!  Kidding aside.  The rolled New York and slow roasted ribs were delicous.  The French style porkchop and the chicken Alfredo were amazing as always.   You can't go wrong!

First time to visit. Fantastic service, food and ambiance. Jesse, our server, was a rock star. Fun to talk to, always paid attention to our libations and made great recommendations on food and wine. Highly recommended!!

Nice and cozy location on the south west side of the town. We came here about an hour before they were closing the restaurant. We ordered clam chowder soup for starters.
