The soup was ok, it seemed like they had to dump the left over  soup with dried up crust in a bowl for us. It wasn't bad, but you can tell that it was made 6 hours ago. 

Our main entree included pesto creme salmon with penne (mine) and my gf got halibut with rice and vegetables. They gave her salmon instead of halibut and didn't even realize it until we brought it up to the waitress attention. She was very nice about it and offered to change it for halibut, but my gf was ok with what she got. My pasta was very good and as I got the fish that I had ordered. 

We ordered their NY cheesecake, which I can say is the best cheesecake I've ever eaten. It was not too sugary and very light for a cheesecake. When the bill came the waitress didn't charge us for the cheese cake. The dessert was on the house since they messed up my gf's order. 

The service is excellent and I'll definately be back to try out their beef wellington.

This was a random yelp find and the other reviews don't lie! Loved this place food was excellent service was great! Totally kid friendly! Atmosphere is very comfortable! Definitely will be recommending this to everyone I know and will be returning shortly!

This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, whether we are just dropping in for a cocktail or having dinner with friends, Zest is our go-to hangout. The management and staff (Billy, Donna and Jess) make you feel very welcome, the food portions are large and the menu is extensive. Check it out!

Where do you get the best fish and chips? We've had fish & chips in every bar I can think of in Vegas...  Today's special at Zest omg best fish and chips in town....  and in the best staff and you just don't have a better meal....  Stephanie and Jesse love you guys....

I've been going to Off The Strip since it opened several years ago, as I live here in Southern Highlands.

I have never had a complaint about their food or service! The food always has great flavor. I take my business meetings, family, dates, etc, to Off the Strip and everyone has always been impressed.

Maybe I am not as picky as some of the negative reviewers here, but who cares if they have a single paint on a plain beige wall? Are we HGTV judges now? What I care is about the food! You don't like garlic? Oh well. I love it :) Everyone's taste is different; it doesn't mean the food is bad.

And by the way, that wall is gone :) They expanded recently, added a full lounge, and now the place gets so busy sometimes, I've had to make reservations.

The staff is super friendly. They know me by name, they recognize my voice on the phone and they are always smiling. :)

Is it expensive? Yes. It's worth it. Their bacon wrapped filet mignon and their softball-sized meatballs are my favorites. Their house salad has great flavor.

Overall, one of my favorite places.

I don't understand why this place has so many stars. It seems to be a bit schizophrenic. Is it a pub? Is it supposed to be fine dining? It isn't a comfy ambiance, and the food wasn't anything special, especially not for the price. I won't be returning here.

Being just around the corner, I eat here weekly. Either dine in or takeout. The food is Phenomenal! The staff is even better! I recommend the chicken stuffed scampi, eggplant parm, chicken parm, salmon dinner. There are also great healthy options that are very tasteful. This is a must try and an excellent option better than on the strip dining with off the strip prices and the friendliest staff!

What an awesome experience!  Pretty unexpected given the random location but the food was great....and the service was even better.  Our server, Stacey knew all the details of the menu and even how the food is prepared to help us make a decision.  The chef sent out some complimentary apps that he is thinking of adding to the menu and they were tasty.  Everyone seemed to generally care about us as customers and were thankful that we were there.  It was a nice change of pace from typical Las Vegas restaurants.

The atmosphere deserves a mention as well.  Nice vibe, lots of TVs and a closed off smoking area if you're into that as well.

The food was delicious and great quality. I got the penne pesto salmon, the salmon was tender. And my girlfriend enjoyed the chicken piccata dish, not heavy but very filling. Our plates came with salads and bread. Service was exceptional! Jesse has great energy and made our first time experience amazing. & to top things off Jesse comped us our cheesecake!!!!!  Definitely looking forward to coming back and trying the pizza.

Amazing customer service! Food was exceptional! Burst of flavor every bite and the cheese cake is made in house and is to die for!  Billy and Nicole were awesome, very nice and welcoming. It was our first time here and we are definitely going to be coming back. Thank you Billy!

Wow, what a wonderful surprise this place turned out to be! Tucked in the corner of a shopping center at Cactus and Southern Highlands Parkway, the setup is a small, casual bistro that looks like it might seat 40 or 50, including some seats at the bar and a small counter. The kitchen's open to the dining area, and in fact forms the entire back half of the restaurant. Prices are quite reasonable, and in many cases, the food is comparable to anything I've eaten, regardless of price point. Our waiter Tom was one of the owners, and his crew maintained a friendly, Brooklyn vibe with their excellent service. Our table shared an insane appetizer of stuffed shrimp wrapped in bacon, baked, then served in a butter sauce, in addition to an outstanding garbage salad. Main courses included rigatoni bolognese with homemade meatballs, Beef Wellington, grilled salmon and chicken saltimbocca. Tom's brother, Chef Al, hit everything he aimed for, and everyone at our table thoroughly enjoyed their meals. A special note must be made about the cheesecake, which other reviewers here on Yelp are raving about with good cause. Simply amazing, and handmade by Al himself everyday on the premises. We'll definitely be back for more!

Zest is the Best! Formerly known as Off the Strip, this place has a new name, but has had the same great food and the same great people for years.  If you're feeling adventurous, ask for the "Around the World", and then sit back, relax, and let the wait staff bring you 7 or 8 tasting size portions of various menu items the house has selected for you. It's an amazing dining experience you won't forget.  If you aren't adventurous enough to give up control, then some of the can't miss menu items are the Bacon wrapped Thai chili prawns, the French pork chops, and the beef Wellington.

This is our first time at zest!!!!! So my lovely patient invited me and boyfriend to come eat....we stayed out with a chicken soup.  Amazing very hearty but light at the same time the flavor wasn't overwelling.....then we had a Capri salad....well done the fresh mozzarella.   Was incredible!!!!!   Fresh basil oil and balsamic vinegar!!!!   Caesar salad to die for the dressing was impeccable....so off to the main course which Donna did recommend The meal....wow the chicken parmesan was mouth watering the chicken tender and marina perfect!    My boyfriend had the pork chops.... OMG.....the sauce was rich creamy and decadent..... the mash potatoes delous....then last but not least the cheese cake wow wow wow!!!!!....every thing was on point with the flavors and temperature.....Donna is amazing she runs this place with poise and Elegance.....hats off to the chefs my compliments.... can't wait to come again and try something else..... recommend this place to anyone who enjoys and good food and authentic flavor......thank you again Donna you Rock!!!!!!
LOVE this restaurant one of the best in VEGAS and you don't have to take out a second mortgage!

I gave them 4 stars because this place is nice and a clean. This place is fairly big and has several tv's. They have a full bar.They are very attentive and the food came out at a decent time. 

On their food I'd give them 3 1/2 stars. The Mussels Oreganata was very good, not over cooked, the panko crumbs gives it some texture and they give you extra bread to dip in the sauce. My husband and I are more on the savory side when it comes to flavor; my scampi stuffed chicken was a little on the sweet side, It was cooked perfectly and not dry though. My husband got the Al's special pork chops which were very tender and juicy, still more on the sweeter side than we'd prefer. Overall nice place we go again to try other things on the menu.

I've lived in Southern Highlands for over 16 yrs but never before ventured into this restaurant until I came across a coupon in the mail.  I think I never considered it because I thought it was simply a steakhouse.  Wrong!  The menu choices were abundant and our wonderful waitress Nicole helped us out by suggesting a few of her favorites.  The meatballs and vodka sauce are the best!  My daughters had the stroganoff and a masala chicken dish over mashed potato and they loved it.  Both service and food get 5 stars from us.  Will most definitely be back!

Nicest, most accommodating, and passionate staff I have encountered in a very long time. This wonderful restaurant is thankfully very much off the strip. Walking in, you are warming greeted and introduced to the special menu, seasonal, and regular. The staff is so caring that you feel as if you are at dinner at a friends house.
The room is warm and casual yet tasteful. The food was great for the price. We had the caprese salad, crab cakes, orange roughy, and the protein dinner. Everything was perfectly seasoned and cooked well. 
As I said the real soul of establishment is it's team. Its truly a family owned and operated joint. I can't wait to go back.

What a wonderful tucked away gem! I came across this place through a post I saw on Facebook and thought we'd give it a try. The prime rib was fantastic and the scallops pasta dish was just wonderful! Zack was a pleasure, and the owner Billy came by our table to introduce himself. They even brought us a piece of the best cheesecake! Such a great establishment, with great food, and even better people. You'll be seeing us again. Thank you for a memorable dinner

Came here with my entire family for a family dinner, place was dead. Wasn't greeted when walked in, we sat down at a large table for 15 minutes with no one coming to ask us what we wanted to drink or even acknowledging us. So we all got up and left and they didn't even care. I don't see this place lasting long at all.
James our server was phenomenal great food great price will definitely come back here again

We just moved to Southern Highlands and so happy to find this neighborhood place!  This place has fabulous service and amazing food! What most impressed me was how fast the waiter came to the table to offer us a drink.  We had our kids and my daughter kept spilling stuff and they were on top of everything.  I spilled the entire pepper on my garbage salad, which was delicious, and they asked if I wanted a new one and I truly didn't and knew it was my fault so didn't want to hassle.  After saying no they still brought another full salad out.  Great artichoke appetizerS! Great happy hour prices too! Can't wait to go back.

Good food, great drinks, bad service. Took us forever to get noticed when drinks were low or empty, forever to order, and it wasn't even busy. When we did order the server didn't mention that when the menu said or, it meant and. I ended up with stuff I didn't even like in my food. Would give 5 stars otherwise.

We walked in here one night after a bad experience at a neighboring restaurant. So we were basically 1/2 full when we arrived here. But despite only trying a couple of items, we were impressed.

First of all, I love the space and atmosphere. It is casual elegance at its finest. It's very small and tucked away in a strip mall. It's dimly lit with a nice wine bar area. In addition to the physical menus, the entire menu is written on chalkboards above the main counter. The whole space is very open - you can sit at your table and watch your meal being prepared in the kitchen. It is not at all what I had pictured in my head back when first reading about this place. It is as if a small mom and pop deli mated with an upscale Italian eatery. It works wonderfully. And it is both a terrific date spot and family dining spot.

Again, we had already somewhat eaten prior to stopping in here, so we opted to share the chili prawns and rigatoni vodka (with a meatball added). And both were outstanding. The chili prawns were just this amazing combination of flavors. We just wished that there were more than two of them (as we happily would have made a meal of just those). The rigatoni vodka definitely held up to my high vodka sauce standards. The rigatoni was perfectly al dente and the meatball was pretty good too. And bonus points for the leftovers reheating well. You know something is great when it tastes good the next day after a spin in the microwave.

We didn't order dessert, but our server surprised us with a complimentary slice of cheesecake. The cheesecake was great and we loved that it was plated with both chocolate and caramel sauce drizzles.

The service was fantastic. Our server was very nice, inquired if this was our first time, how we heard about it, etc.

This is definitely a place high on the return visit list.
Good food. Great portion size.

Came in here around 9:30am with K.O. We came here specifically because we wanted to try the the Beef Wellington after watching a show with Gordon Ramsey in it. 

When we came in we were greeted by a very friendly waiter. The restaurant was pretty empty so we were seated very promptly. 

The waiter went over some of their specials and explained the menu to us a little bit.

Appetizer
-tomato caprese: never really a fan of this dish but it was ok here. 

We split 
-beef wellington: we both had the Caesar salad with our entree and they weren't kidding when they said it's super garlicky. It was delicious. The beef Wellington was super juicy and tender and the knife cut through it like butter. The outer crust was very crispy and flaky and delicious. 
-lobster ravioli: this dish was a little lacking. The sauce was kind of bland. It just didn't have that much flavor. This was the only dish we were disappointed with. 


Now we paid for the check then decided to check out the dessert menu last minute. The waiter was really cool about it and just gave us a complimentary slice of cheesecake. He said that we had to try it and it's on the house. He wasn't lying when he said the cheesecake was delicious. It was very cream cheesey and the bottom graham cracker crust was delicious. 

Only reason this place didn't get 5 stars was because the lobster ravioli wasn't up to par. But everything else was spot on. Will definitely come back and try some other dishes.

I used to love this place but it has steadily declined lately. Today I went for the last time. It started by the fact that we sat there for a good 15 minutes before our drink order was taken (due to the delay, we ordered our food at this time as well). Then another 15 before our drinks arrived. Probably 30 minutes went by before the food started to come out. When I say "started" I mean, it all did not come out at the same time. In fact by the time I got my order, all 5 other people at our table (including 3 other adults, my 3 year old and 6 year old) had completely finished their plates.  When my order finally did come out it was wrong. 

I ordered the Mediterranean salad off the brunch menu. According to the menu, it was supposed to have the following: mixed greens, kalamata olives, feta cheese, orzo, peppers, tomatoes, cucumbers and asparagus. I asked for no tomatoes and added chicken for an extra $5. What came out was a salad with mixed greens, kalamata olives, feta cheese, cucumbers, chopped pieces of penne pasta, and chicken. There was no asparagus, no peppers and no orzo. FYI, chopped penne pasta does not equal orzo. I sent it back. At this point I asked for the salad to go because everyone had finished eating and my kids had reached their max restaurant sitting threshold. When I got home I opened the salad and it was still wrong. It had no peppers and no orzo--again, chopped penne pasta is not orzo. 

First, I do not fault the server. She was very nice and as attentive as she could be. She was the only person serving. There were 8 tables at one point and she was handling all of them the best anyone could. This is an under staffing problem and I blame management. 

Second, orzo is not penne pasta. If the menu states an item has certain ingredients, those should be the ingredients used. If there is a shortage of an ingredient for some reason and a substitution is necessary, then the patron should be told upon ordering. 

Third, order was wrong--twice. The chef should be trained to know what's in each dish on the menu.
Been coming here for 5 years and won't stop! All of the servers are exceptional but Miguel stands out to me. Overall love this place, I drive from the strip 3-5 times a month to eat here!

When you walk in the door there's no counter or hostess podium so you don't know if you're supposed to wait to be seated or seat yourself. I waited at the door for about 10-15 minutes with no acknowledgement of my presence by any of the employees so I left. Huge disappointment. Customer service needs lots of improvement

My mom and I went in for a quick bite and a couple glasses of wine and were blown away. I've been here a couple times before but this time it was truly memorable. We had the mussels oreganata and the prawns in a sweet chili sauce. Also, our server was great, she was so sweet and helpful and even gave us a slice of cheesecake on the house.

Amazing... I know this is case by case but just entered our local favorite restaurant to sit down with my family and had the Nicest kindest family PAY for our meal ..... I'm greatful and humbled ..... Had no clue and wish I could thank them personally..... This is the type of environment Zest is .... Culture , good food and family ! ...... I'm 35 years old and this is single handly the Nicest thing that had ever happened to us ,.. that K you again !!  Again amazing food and great service !!!!

The first time I came here I only had cocktails and dessert. Their cheesecake is the absolute best!! This time we actually had dinner and the food was 100% delicious! We had the Garlic Pesto Bread, Caesar salad, Truffle Mac N Cheese, Carrot Ginger Bisque Soup, and the Spaghetti Squash Pasta. The presentation was great and each dish was perfectly prepared! You can really tell the flavors are carefully thought out. The restaurant has a very intimate feel with a high quality menu but it's big enough to accommodate large groups. The owner and staff are super friendly and welcoming, they really made us feel like family. Our server was Donna and she was excellent! The only thing I didn't like was that the Caesar salad had too much dressing for my taste but that's just my preference.  I'll definitely be back and maybe even celebrate birthdays here, this place is a gem.
This place is fantastic! Great food, friendly owners, & always a like-family atmosphere. Definitely recommend this place. Don't really have a kids menu but is kid-friendly.

Awsome food and service. I had the beef stroganoff and my friend had the pork chops.  Both were great. Many choices on the menu and a list of daily specials. Our waiter Yainni had great wine suggestions. My friend had Stella beer that was on tap. We will be back and would definitely recommend this place for someone looking for great food.

Excellent place we found service was impeccable and food was awesome. The grilled vegetable plarrer was to die for. They have an enclosed glass cigar smoking room great little room for about 15. Will definitely go back.

Came in here for dinner and hoping for something good.  

I convinced a friend to come with me and yes at first I was having a hard time trying to decide what to get.  Everything sounded interesting.  Our server was very nice, she gave us some time to decide and another gentlemen approached us for our order.  Now it gets good, he gives us a detail about the specials.  Place was a bit dark and I couldn't see all the way up to the front.  First thing he offered was the pork chops; covered in mushroom sauce with bacon bits and a side of mash with bacon infused.  "SOLD!" My friend got the other special Tortelini Ragu.  Our orders came with a side salad.  They had two different kinds: house and cesar.  I got the house and it was very good and the cesar was actually very different.  A bit spicy and those croutons had a special taste.  Didn't take too long for them to get our orders out.  My oh my.. that pork chop was very excellent! Smothered in sauce and bacon bits.. Two fairly decent sized pork chop.  Meat was just right, not over cooked where my jaw would hurt.  My friend's pasta was very good as well.  Portion was very huge and had to be taken home.  Pork chops didn't not make it home with me.  We were offered some desert and I heard that the cheesecake is good here.  Sadly, we were stuffed so definitely next time!

Place is well open spaced.  Bar area and large flat screens with games on.  Great place to hang out and catch a game and some cheesecake.  Staff was very nice and I did scare him a bit when he came by and asked if "everything good."  

I'll have to come back to try the other specials they had to offer and of course that cheesecake.

Perfect late night meal! I have been wanting to try this place for awhile and was not disappointed. The seating area was a little empty but the bar side was very lively. We decided to eat on the restaurant side because we wanted to catch up. The decor is very basic bar interior nothing really stood out but it was clean and neat. 
I ordered the Manhattan and let's just say the bartender had a heavy pour. I will never complain about that...lol. For appetizer we had the garlic pesto bread which was fantastic. I really like the cheese and tomato topping. Entree I ordered the chicken and artichokes over mashed potatoes. It was delicious I especially like the mashed potatoes and the chicken was very moist. My friend had the roasted vegetables which was colorful and looked good. I would probably eat vegetables more if it was cooked like that. Our server was really nice and attentive. It was a great spot to catch up with a friend over some good food.

The best and only Beef Wellington you can get in this city. I never have anything else. I also love the spagetti and meatball and/or sausage, the Roller New Yorks (asparagus with a sun dried tomatoe cheese spread rolled in a thinpice of New York steak and cooked up) and well, I can't list everything. A MUST TRY! 

Plus a great staff and wine list!

started out great.....ordered the mussels. ...outstanding,      best i have had in all of vegas.....but it ended there had the special...shrimp and macaroni. ...sauce was good but macaroni was way over cooked...mushy. .my friend ordered a macaroni dish aswell.....this was very very under cooked... still hard .......manager tried to make right with free cheesecake. ..... think i will pass on this place......disappointed. .
heard some good things about this place....

Thirteen of us made reservation for March 21st.  Unfortunately we were running late.  We call and they agreed to hold our reservation for 35 minutes.  When we arrived they seated us immediately.  We ordered drinks and agreed on letting the chef select small plates for us.  This turned out to be great.  Every dish was outstanding.  They kept bring food until we cried uncle.  I would do this again, when we are in Las Vegas.  What a treat.  John

This was my brother in laws pick for his birthday dinner. At first, I admit my sister and I snooted it out by appearance. Our birthday dinners are usually gourmet restaurants. To my surprise, the servers were super friendly and the food was awesome. I ordered the shrimp scampi over linguini. Very good. Huge prawns were flavorful with a great sauce. My husband ordered the Fettucini Alfredo with shrimp the sauce was great and the prawns again were very flavorful. My sister had the penne with vodka sauce the dish was delicious. My Brother in law order the pork chops which were awesome as well. Very moist and flavorful. Even the salads were great. Did not have a chance to taste it but, my brother in law said it was the best caesar salad he has ever eaten. 
Will definetly return.

Went last night, on a date!  We read about it on Yelp, and on trip advisor, and since we live 4 miles from there decided to try it out.  The place is great and the atmosphere amazing.  Food was to die for, we tried pork roulade, chicken saltimbocca, n scampi stuffed chicken!  I do have to be honest it was a tad bit salty for me.
   Was a lil busy when we got there, but we had great service, n met one of the owners.. He apologized for the wait on our food, which in reality was not long at all....to end our night we had a slice of heaven(homemade fluffy, yummy,cheesecake)!!!  Mmmmmmm mmmm mm!  Can't wait to try more!..

If you are in Southern Highlands - this is really the place to go.  The food is great and the atmosphere relaxed. It is a tiny bit expensive so it is not our everyday place (believe me when I say we eat out every meal!) but we do like to come here every couple of weeks.  The quality is worth the splurge.
the greatest food in vegas the steaks were amazing,and the cheese cake was delicious.thank u

I heard about this place and finally got to check it out, and I'm guessing it was not the best time to visit. This past Friday night the special was Mahi Mahi, and mine was so over cooked as to be almost ruined. I'd have sent it back, but the place was so busy, and the wait to get what we had was so long I decided to just settle for what came. My guest said the same about his Eggplant Parm, over cooked and he did not even finish it or take the rest home, that's how bad it was. The bill for the two of us was over $100 with just two cocktails involved, and even these were mediocre at best.  I won't go back, at that price point, there was just no excuse for the long wait and the poor quality of the entrees.

The place expanded to add more seating, and when it did, the overall quality seems to have suffered, or so my guest, a local resident, told me afterwards. He apologized for recommending it; talk about awkward.

The bread was even of poor quality; to be fair, the salad was really good, one of the best I've ever had at any price, the Really Trashy Garbage Salad, yes that's the name, was great; we got ours with mozzarella instead of bleu cheese. It was wonderful, and provided the basis for the forthcoming major disappointment.

Went to off the strip for the first time last night and Donna was very nice and seemed very genuine and passionate about their restaurant. Must try the potato cake! Also had the grilled salmon and rice... Cooked to perfection... After all the great reviews i had to write one myself and i will keep going back for more.

Finally had a chance to check out Zest's Sunday brunch since the name changed from 'Off The Strip'. 

We opted not to do the All You Can Eat brunch and instead ordered al la carte.  We were a bit disappointed at portion sizes (1/2 waffle with turkey meat in it... $10). We were told the al la carte servings are basically one 'round' of the all you can eat option.  Everything tasted great, just didn't think it was a good value.

The restaurant next door had a wait, so decided to go here instead.  It was great!  The name didn't  stand out to me.  Luckily my friend was with me and suggested it.  There were no tables available so we sat at the bar.  Every time the door opened we could feel a cold chill which was consistent throughout dinner.  

I couldn't decide on wine so I was offered a taste of the two German rieslings. The castle was too sweet, so I went what I know... Dr Loosen. Love that one.  He did forget the lemons for our water. 

Bread is served skinny loaf with a couple of partial slices through and toasted to a crunch.  Butter packets on the side. 

The entrees came with salad, I requested and alternative as I don't eat salad.  They offered me a chicken  vegetable soup.  It wasn't terrible.  I did question of it came out of a can. It was very salty but would have been good otherwise. It did have carrots, potatoes, zucchini, and kale. 

Ordered the special, Sea Bass with sweet chili sauce. It arrived in the other lemon caper sauce.  He was eager to fix the issue and brought another fish in the sauce we ordered. The sweet chili had a kick and a sticky texture because of the sauce.  Was over powering in my taste and took away from the sea bass.  Friend loved it.  I preferred the lighter flavored and flaky texture of the lemon caper. 

The chicken fettuccine alfredo was great.  Creamy sauce good all around.  

Almost forgot my precious to go box and the bartender reminded me.  Server was friendly and attentive. Wanted to try the beef Wellington but seemed pricey.  Just a bit more than I prefer to spend here over other restaurant options.

Damn!  That is all.  Pretty much perfect all around.  Service was just absolutely amazing, the waiters and hostess cared for us SO well.  Their wine of a month was a fantastic Pinot Noir, that I had to get a pic of the label.  Just buttery and amazing.  The four of us ordered different entrees, including two specials and they were all magnificent.  I'm not a gourmet cook, but pretty close and there was nothing that I could think of to improve.  The prices are very reasonable and the food is just flat freakin' amazing.  Just go already!!

We wanted an evening away from the hubbub and ding ding of the Strip, so we headed out to Off The  Strip which is about 12 miles away. It is a small bar/restaurant with a pleasant atmosphere. The food was excellent and so was the service staff. I will definitely be back in future trips to this area.

This place is a hidden gem. The service is excellent friendly and quick. The food is excellent as well. We mostly ordered pasta dishes they were all excellent but i want to try the pork chops ... it is a special on the board. I would highly recommend giving this place a try.

Visiting from out of town and went here on the recommendation of our family. Seven of us came in and were immediately seated. 
There is no need to drive to the strip and wait with hundreds of other people. Zest is quite simply the best food we have had the entire week of being here. 
Our party had Lamb, Pork Chops, Filet Mignon, Cajun Steak, and Beef Wellington.  Everyone at the table voted 5 stars all around!!
If your going out to eat put this place on your short list.

Remember the show "Cheers"?  Where everybody knows your name!!! That's Zest!  But zest is classy with fantastic food, incredible staff, an owner who is passionate about his business and makes everyone feel like they are his "favorite customer".
Can't say enough about the dinner menu:: shortrib ravioli, rib eye steak (traditional for me), chicken parm and the cheesecake is top notch!!!!!
They just opened this weekend for brunch and it was AMAZING!!!!! Finally, a great brunch place in #southernhighlands which conveniently reopens at 4 for a great evening ;-)
I highly recommend Zest Bistro and Bar!!!
Shout out to Donna, Jesse, Johnny and everyone else who makes this place a great place to eat drink and be merry ;-)

We've been here several times in the last 4 years. It's never been amazing to us, but average. Everyone has different tastes, so I can see how maybe others think it's great. So you may want to give it a try and see if its for you. There are a lot of good reviews - I just have never had the pleasure of that experience here.
Last night was the last time we'll come here. Not only was the food average again, my son's meal came with a giant hair in his burger. It was cooked in to the meat. And hanging out on to the rest of the plate. I have no idea how the cook could have missed that while he was cooking or plating,  but he obviously did.
I had the chicken Tristina, and it was cooked with some fresh ingredients, but it was bland. The chicken was cooked well but the coating was soggy. The vegetables it was stuffed with included mushrooms, which I wasn't told, but didn't mind that. I was sharing with my son and wouldn't have ordered though because he doesn't like them.
The wait staff is always very kind, so I don't want this to reflect on them at all. I do feel the food is over priced, even though the portions are large. The ingredients seem to be fresh, but we have never had anything that was amazing or made us say "wow". My husbands words as we left were "I feel disappointed, just not satisfied." I have to agree. Again. Unfortunately we won't be back.
Good food! Good service! Definitely one of my favorite locations for dinner. Certainly would recommend Zest!

Pretty decent food especially if you want something healthy but still delicious. I got the salmon which was amazing. I wish they wouldn't have been so greedy with the side asparagus. They only sent 2 pieces over a salad. That was extremely disappointing. Asparagus isn't expensive to only give two pieces per plate. My friend order a dish that she asparagus as well and she received only 2 as well. I would have rather not had the salad and more asparagus. The wait time for the food seemed long as well. It seemed other people were being served way before us. The service was ok, we had to call other waiters over to us to assist because our waiter seemed to forget us. He asked if we wanted bread we said yes but it never came. Drinks were not refilled. It was disappointing. The time of night we went was 8PM and it wasn't packed at all so no reason for the crappy service. Hopefully they get some better servers and stop being greedy with the asparagus. Because there salmon is one of the best salmons I have ever had.

Off the Strip-Just Real Food is off the hook! My wife and I ate there last evening and the search was worth the effort. We were greeted at the door by owner/chef Tom. Tom was friendly and attentive and we soon began casual conversation regarding his first passion-great food! I allowed Tom to conjure up a meal of his specialities...WOW what a meal. Would highly recommend everyone to get "off the strip" and try this hidden gem of a restaurant. Try the cheesecake!

Food is delish, service is amazing especially by Joanne. If you're anything like me service is important. Ambiance is also great, chill and relaxed. Glad I found this place. My new neighborhood go to. Thanks for being around Zest!

We live in the area, and we've been there several times, and still no one greets us with "Cheers" abandon. I frankly don't even care about any of that. I just want good food. And Zest doesn't have it. If you want good tapas, go down the strip mall to another place to have that. If you want absolutely the freshest, best Italian food, go to the spaghetti place right beside the tapas place. We've given this place so many tries, so many visits, and they just never follow through with good, fresh food. I won't give this place one star on yelp, as I don't want to push a place out of business. But I also won't lie and give this place 3 stars either. If you really want to go there, then feel free to give it a try. You may like it. But our family does not. We don't plan on ever going back there.

price is too high for this type of restaurant.
beef willington for $36? (I think $29 is reasonable)
the rib ravioli has what taste like mash potato gravy , a bit too salty.
the willington's sauce also taste a bit similar to the gravy sauce. 
it's cooked perfectly though. portion is not very big.
the pasta is very large portion so it's worth the money.
service is excellent
People, this is probably the best Turkey Club Sandwich I've ever had for this Sunday's Brunch!!!

Great service, quality, fresh food. New York roller for appetizer was wonderful. Got the steak and chicken kabab, cooked perfectly and tasted great. My friend got the lobster ravioli and loved it. I thought his dish was average and didn't taste like lobster. Short wine list but good options.

Wow, what a change for the better!

My wife and I first tried Zest a few years ago and had a terrible dinner so decided not to go back until just recently, and wow, what a change for the better!
The service is outstanding, the menu varied, the drinks poured heavy, and the flavors superb, so I would highly recommend Zest.
The only reason I didn't give another star is due to their steaks, which I find sub-par and I just can't recommend, but please don't let that stop you, yo'd be missing out on a terrific meal.

Awesome service, Donna was great, food was tasty and the drinks were reasonable  atmosphere was comfortable with good music.  
Definitely will return

Friendly atmosphere and good food. It's a little more expensive, but that seems to be from using good ingredients and making everything themselves. The waitress was really friendly. We made reservations and they had a table set up and waiting for us, which was nice.

It's been a while since I've eaten at Off the Strip. They were on my top 10 favs. So it seemed like the perfect choice after a game to take some friends for dinner.
I made reservations for 8-and waited till 8:30 to be seated.
I had to settle the bar bill before I sat down as it couldn't be transferred over and that took another 10 minutes while I stood there trying to hand her the signed check.
Anyway, to the point-my favorite braciole is still terrific, but I ordered 2 orders and got one plate w/4-only 2 per order? Maybe I'm wrong but wasn't there 3 before?
There are no longer any veal options available and it seems other items have been removed from the list.
The quaint menu board over the kitchen that previously listed the menu and specials is now filled with promotional messaging-like happy hour, football etc.
One of the meals the spinach was in limbo between just pulled from the earth to thrown in the pan and pulled. A sauce was over the veggies which was just no good.
They removed that entree and threw in a cheesecake so 5 star for their attempt to rectify the situation to the best.
My guest didn't even eat their entree and had it boxed after a couple bites politely stating she was full.
I'm just sad that OTS may be succumbing to the typical "started out as a hole in the wall" to grow too big for their britches losing sight of what differentiated them vs others.
There is a new place steps from there called Spaghetti Western which interested me and I have to say I'll try them next time I'm in the Southern Highlands area before heading back to OTS.

Great food and great service.  Enjoyed the pasta dish I had while my wife downed "the M.O.A.B." (the mother of all burgers). Both dishes were delicious and the bruschetta along with artichoke appetizers were just the right size and were amazing.

It was busy and very loud but we were sitting in the bar area so that's understandable.

There was a small mixup on my wife's order but our waitress generously and unsolicited comped us a piece of cheesecake.  It was worth the trip to the restaurant by itself.

Overall a great dining experience and we'll be going back.

My husband and I absolutely love coming here on date nights!! The food is ALWAYS so delectable and amazing. Anything we ever order always taste amazingly homemade with a bit of fanciness. My husbands favorite meal is the Beef Wellington, it's really good. The staff is always friendly as well which is a nice plus. I don't prefer to bring my children here, for me personally I don't think it's the right fit.
Besides that all in all we love this place!

We have been to Off the Strip in Southern Highlands a number of times and have NEVER. Been disappointed. The lasagna, baked ziti, and beef stroganoff are all fabulous and even their kids chicken strips are hand breaded and amazing.  The staff is always friendly and the crowd seems to be a number of business-type regulars who obviously have good reason for return. However, the absolute best part of off the strip HAS to be the cheesecake. It is very moist and creamy and puts all others to shame.... Even the restaurant that uses the famous dessert in its name! A definite must try if you've never been, you won't be disappointed.
I liked this place.  I thought the appetizers were small but sinners are huge.

This is our favorite place to eat as a family ;) their food is just amazing and my girls are in love with the salmon Caesar. Donna is the manager here and she is always welcoming even on their crazy busy nights ! Best of all the cheesecake is to die for !!!! Best one in town hands down.

Have visited this location a few times in the last year or so with my friend who lives in that part of town. We sit in the bar area and always have had good attentive service from the bar staff. 
Food wise I have had the pastas and salads and on one occasion the pasta was cold when delivered and the bartender took it back and had the kitchen make a new plate of pasta for me and then did not charge me for the dish. 
I have not had a bad experience there and will continue to visit this location.

We go here about once a week and it never disappoints.  Kids eat free with an adult meal. We love the meatballs, skinny pork chop with kale, french dip, and their bar.  Its easy to eat healthy if you want.  The servers are awesome. Miguel and Nicole are super attentive and quick.  Perfect for a date night, family night, or just go to the bar for drinks and apps.

I can't give this place any less than 5 stars because I eat here a lot and I always enjoy the food. I have tried a lot of the different items on the menu and I have enjoyed everything thoroughly. My personal favorite is their scallops special. I highly recommend that....and the bacon wrapped prawns appetizer. :)

My second visit. The first time I visited, I was not able to enjoy my meal because of being "under the weather.".  (What happens in Vegas....)  This time I had my full appetite and 16 friends and it was Nervana. You have got to eat here!  Unanimously, everyone thought was best meal ever.  We had the Around The World meal where portions of multiple dishes were served.  $700 + I had no regret at the best meal I had ever had.  It is really off the strip but well worth the drive.(Just found this review in my saved.  Was from July 2011. Had not posted it.  My wife and I went again last July 2012 and the food was as great as ever.  We will be back in June and guaranteed one of our dinners will be here).

Neighborhood bar that also has a pizza place attached, it seemed. We sat at the bar for happy hour and was unimpressed. The manager had on gloves because she was cutting fruit but preformed many tasks with out removing them (cash register, turned on tv poured drinks) and then returned to continue cutting. So strange to watch. We had a few appetizers and a drink. Don't even know what we ate. Sad because there is so little to offer in Southern Highlands.

The food was great!  We had the calamari, the rolled beef, and garlic bread for starters.  All of it was great.  Then we had the chicken Parmesan, the sea bass, and French style pork chops, and Caesar salads.  Loved it all!  We will be back.

This place continues to be my favorite spot in Vegas. It's versatile and reliable. The meals and service never let me down. 

Fine. I work on the Strip. I get the 5 star dining thing, and it has its place. But it isn't personal. It isn't supposed to be an everyday experience.  

Suppose I told you that there was a spot that could hit on great food and a comfortable atmosphere every time?  Would you want to go?  You would. 

Enter Zest. 

This particular trip was for brunch, which also happens to be my favorite. Getting to have steak and eggs for $14 is amazing. Adding on the ability to finish your daughter's panCAKES (emphasis intentional as they're baked not griddles) and Bloody Mary's for $5 and I'm ready to move in. Forget that it is the caloric intake equivalent to my week, the food is fantastic. 

Service doesn't get better and it embodies the heart of Vegas- personal and efficient. They treat you like family and deserve the same from you when you tip, so don't skimp. 

As we were driving away this time we resolved to make it a more regular stop. Anyone who says Vegas isn't real needs a little more Zest in their life.

Visiting with my brother. Was introduced to this place by my cousin who is a local in Vegas. I must say that the food is sooooooooo good! 
It was my first time here and I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp recommended by my cousin. He said it was the best he has ever had so I had to try it for myself. All I can say about the pasta: Amazing!!!!!! 
It was not like any other fettuccine Alfredo pasta I've ever had. It was sooooooo good! And so filling! The sauce is truly homemade! 
I will definitely come back for some more!!!!! If you're looking for a good Italian spot to eat, this place is definitely a must try! It's super totes ummmmmazing! You won't regret it for sure!!!!!

We don't have to many restaurants in southern highlands, zest by far one of my favorite restaurants, dinner is amazing , and they have a brunch on Sunday that not to Many people know about but it's awesome , food is always amazing and staff is very friendly
Diverse menu. We had the gnocci ragu and beef wellington... very good and reasonably priced  Drinks were a tad too strong but decent. Excellent customer service. Would definitely recommend.

Food was good, drinks were good, service was great. If I had to make a complaint it would be that the atmosphere wasn't what I was expecting, more of a sports bar feel than a restaurant. Not that it was bad atmosphere but just not what I was expecting after looking at the menu online. We will most definitely return.
Loved this place.  Our server was wonderful and the food was delicious.  Worth the trip Off the Strip!

Has gotta be one of my favorite local restaurants. It's food stands up to the big fancy named strip restaurants. My boyfriend lives right next to it over in the Southern Highlands area, so we go there or order take out often. The atmosphere is laid back,  full bar, with televisions, as well as a large dining area filled with lots of locals casually dressed, enjoying dinner and having a beer or a glass of wine.  What you get from the restaurant is kind of unexpected. You would never guess that such a good restaurant would be located in the middle of a Smith's grocery store plaza. Nevertheless, the food does not lie. 

Seeing as though I've been here countless times, I'll give reviews on the dishes I love most. For apps, my faves are the calamari, the mussels, and the crab cakes. The calamari is made to order, served super fresh and hot along side the tastiest chunky marinara. I think they marinate the calamari in buttermilk or SOMETHING for DAYS because it is literally the most tender, softest calamari I've ever tried. The breading is light and crisp, not overpowered by oil and grease! 

The mussels oreganata is also one of my favorite apps. It is served in the pan that it was baked in. The mussels are topped with a garlic, lemon, buttery bread crumb concoction, with a white wine sauce. So good!

The crab cakes are also amazing. They've gotta be the biggest crab cakes I've ever seen (although they HAVE gotten smaller over time:-/ ), with crab pieces the size of quarters/half dollars lol! They're pan fried and topped with a creamy lemon sauce. Delicious!

They also serve a delicious Caesar salad (or regular salad, if you prefer) before your entree. I love the Caesar salad--it's got a HEAVY garlic taste but that's one of the things I love about it. In fact, a lot of their dishes are heavy on the garlic lol! Garlic breath for sure haha!

For the entrees, I love to order the chicken artichoke, the lobster ravioli, or the filet mignon! The chicken artichoke is sautéed pieces of chicken breast and artichokes served in a lemon butter sauce with vegetables on top of delicious soft mashed potatoes.

I don't eat pasta much because I try to steer clear from carbs, but the lobster ravioli is delicious enough to make you forget and say, "what carbs?!" Lobster and cheeses stuffed into their handmade pasta, the ravioli is then tossed in a red sauce with chunky tomatoes and asparagus. Delicious!!

The filet mignon is supreme! Especially for a place that's not really a steak house, the filet is delicious. In fact, when I crave for a good hunk of meat, I'll take one of these to go! It's usually served with mashed potatoes and veggies. You can also have the filet wrapped in bacon and/or topped with Gorgonzola sauce, delicious as well!

Now for dessert. The only dessert I've tried there is their cheesecake. Which every now and then, the owners will complimentarily bring one out to first timers or regulars. It's creamy and rich, served with strawberry, chocolate and caramel sauces. Good for cheesecake lovers!

The beautiful thing about Off the Strip is that the staff is so friendly and accommodating, they'll make suggestions to your order, and will gladly make changes to any dish to accommodate your palate. 

The only negative thing I can say is that it is a bit more on the pricier side. Especially considering that it is such a casual, local, neighborhood restaurant. Definitely not something I can have everyday of the week! But you pay for the food you get! Delicious and satisfying every time!

Zest has been a staple dining spot for my wife and I, the food, service and atmosphere is fantastic.  They recently added new menu items and always offer specials.  If you are looking for a great meal, they have something for everyone and never disappoint!

Not bad, it's more like a 3.5 rating I rounded up because I definitely will be back.

The menu is a mixture of Italian and American dishes....I feel like it's more so Italian than American. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan sandwich, comes with steak fries and my boyfriend ordered the Chicken Milanese. I know it doesn't matter to some, but I love my food to be pippin hot. And pippin hot was what Zest delivered. To my surprise, my sandwich was on the smaller size. I finished the entire thing in one sitting. Normally I would have leftovers but nope...not here. It was just right for a dinner portion though. Boyfriend actually loved his dish more than I liked mine. I wasn't in the pasta mood that night, but next time, I want to give some of them a try. They looked (from Yelp pics) and sound really good!!!!

Service was attentive. Atmosphere was a nice locals-feel restaurant. Just be aware of the one person bathroom. Don't wait until you really have to go or else you risk running to the bathroom only to find out someone is in there. I don't know why restaurants do that. It should be against code laws to only have 1 bathroom per gender. Even most Mc Donald's have multiple stall restrooms.
Wow the eggplant parmigiana is fantastic here! First time back in a long time, it was quiet but the food was good! We will be back!

Last night had the Thai Chili Bacon Wrapped Prawns appetizer and I wanted to take a bath in the sauce. It was that good. Korean Beef for dinner was amazing. Have to shout our server Stephanie. She made several recommendations and was super attentive even though they were getting busier. Doesn't get much better than great food with great service. When you see the owner each time you go in, speaking with the guests and making sure you're okay, you know you're in the right place.

Excellent food, service and prices! Just went there for the first time. My husband and I had the rib ravioli app and beef wellington for entree. First time having wellington, loved it! Also, our waiter brought us a free piece of cheesecake for first time patrons, excellent! good size portions too! I highly recommend it!

Great food, Great service. Owner Operated and they care. Great place to go eat any meal of the day like coming downstairs and mom says she will cook you anything you want. A nice addition to local restaurants for all of us industry peeps.

I love Zest! Donna always makes me feel so welcome every time I come in. Great food, I usually share a garbage salad with a friend and then just ask what I should get from the apps or entrees. Had the salmon risotto last time which was delicious.

This was far and away the best place I ate at while I was in Las Vegas. The staff was amazing! Everyone was so friendly and attentive. The bartender even took the time to introduce himself and ask my name, which has never happened to me in my life. If that wasn't enough to blow me away, the food definitely was. I had the lasagna special, which was rich, cheesy, and cooked perfectly. The cheesecake was also amazing - definitely had that homemade taste which I love. Highly recommend this place - you're guaranteed to leave with a smile on your face and a very full stomach!

We love Zest Bistro for dinner and finally had a chance to try their Sunday Brunch today. They do have an all you can eat option but  we ordered a la cart. My husband and son ordered the Loaded Omelet, I ordered the Truffle Egg Sandwich and son's girlfriend ordered the chicken waffle sandwich. My husband and I split the oatmeal, that was perfect just as it came, no butter or anything else necessary. We did eat everything but I couldn't have eaten anything else. James made sure we were well taken care of, we always had our coffee topped off, and water glasses. He even brought some of their sirracha wings for us to sample. The Bloody Mary and Mimosa was also very good. All in all a very good experience. We will definitely be back for the Brunch.

Off the hook should be the name...the service is so cool, the family style dinner concept with no menu is great, the passion the owner had for the business is apparent. 7 course meal, dessert hmmm great cheesecake!!!  Good wine selection, best place I've had the pleasure to eat at in Vegas, and I've hit a few great spots,

My husband and I had spent the day touring Hoover Dam and planned to dine in at our hotel. I wanted a steak but the hotel restaurant was closed. Being the owner of a small restaurant in the Chicago-land area (Nu Crepes) I looked to Yelp for the answer. And boy was I happy to find OTS. 

The Beef Wellington was/is absolutely amazing. Cooked perfectly. Melt in your mouth goodness.The potatoes that comes with it should be against the law they're so good.  Caesar salad is the bomb. The steak wrapped asparagus (forgot the appetizer correct name) is so good it made my eyes roll back in my head. Tortilla soup made my husband sit up and speak if its goodness until the bowl was clean. 

Our server was so friendly she kept bringing us more bread and different salad dressings to try. You can tell she loved working there. She also gave us a free bottle of  Death Valley soda when I told her we just spent three days there. And of course just like many of the other reviewers stated, we were given a free slice of deliciously wonderful cheesecake. I overheard a brief conversation she had with another table when she brought the two gentlemen their free piece of  cheesecake..."what's the catch" they said...she said, "no catch, we're just nice". Indeed they are and it shows in their food their genuine love for their restaurant, product and their customers. 
I also appreciate their open kitchen. We do the same at our restaurant. Keep up the good work. Can't wait to come back. 
Thanks for a most enjoyable, delicious dining experience.

Prices are a little high....bar had good selection....cheesecake was WONDERFUL....the chicken dishes were good...pasta not so good....need more waitresses, one on Saturday night is not enough even though the gentleman that was really a big helper for her tried really hard to make everyone happy.  The table and chairs were not comfortable and very bare...absolutely no atmosphere...maybe seeing in the kitchen is a good thing but it sure did not make for a "dining " experience.  I probably will not go back unless I get a coupon and Ijust don't want to cook and if it is not a special occassion.

A-MAZE-ING!!! 

That is the 1 word that best describes the entire place.

The food, the ambiance, the owner, everything!!

I have eaten here numerous times with my wife and our friends and family and the result is always the same.  You leave feeling great, full of good food, and the time flies by.  You're never rushed and Tom the owner is always there with a smile for you and a recommendation of what's good that night.  Even though everything is great every night.

They always have specials, and you have to try every appetizer they have.  We usually fill up on all those that by the time we get our main course, we are stuffed.

Great wine and beer selection for a smaller restaurant.  They are expanding too!!!  Take out and a bigger dining area.  YAY!!  Can't wait till I get to please my palate again.

Thanks TOM!

It kills me to update this review, and I didnt want to do it at the time because I thought with the name change, things would have improved by the time we decided to come back. Well according to the lower ratings they obviously haven't. That's why I haven't and won't return. The last 2 meals from this place stick out in my mind because they are DRASTICALLY DIFFERENT than the early days of us visiting what used to be Off The Strip. Fortunately the only thing that remained tasty was the rolled new york. But the taste stopped there. Both my mother's plates from the last two visits (both chicken dishes) were too bland. Salt much? Portions dimished by half from what we received under the previous name. My plates were the shrimp scampi and beef wellington. I remember the welly being dry and falling apart, (definitely not the mass of deliciousness the first time I tried it) but the shrimp scampi was the biggest difference/disappointment. The first time (back with the former name) that had to be the best plate of scampi IN MY LIFE. The garlic, perfectly cooked pasta, shrimp grilled to perfection, the parmesan, OMG. The second time, (under the present name) it was nothing but a lemony, overcooked bland of a mess. No garlic whatsoever, (Seriously?!? No garlic on a scampi dish AT ALL?!? Then its not scampi. Sorry.) and shrimp was rubbery. I was so appalled I had to look around to see if we were in the same establishment. Obviously the flavor left with the old name considering all the low reviews now. Its a damn shame, but this place is no longer on our list of favs for visiting Vegas. Its just not worth the time or money anymore.

While it's location is a little unassuming, this place is top notch!  The staff is ALWAYS super friendly and very attentive.  They always make you feel welcome.  We are regulars, but they've treated us like that from the start. They have a very nice selection on the menu and everything that I've ever had has been great.  Really!!  My favorite meal is to start with the "sweet chili and bacon prawn" appetizer, then a Caesar salad and finally the filet with vegetables.  Awesome!!  I love the garlic flavor in the Caesar salad.  A good wine suggestion that is not on the wine list is a Cabernet called "Educated Guess".  A funny name with an interesting label and a very nice wine. To finish, their coffee and cheesecake is awesome.  One piece is plenty to share with 2 or 3 people.  Especially after such a great meal. Not that you should go to a place just because celebrities go there, but we've seen some dining alongside us at this restaurant located in a strip mall.  It's that good. They did a wonderful job of transforming the interior decor to a warm and comfortable eatery.  I HIGHLY recommend this place!!!

First I want to say, the night my boyfriend and I came in it was about 30 mins until closing time and anytime we walk into a place that late, I expect lesser quality service. What we got was FAR from that. The lady who served us was so friendly, genuine, and attentive that it was as if we were her first customers of the day. We ordered a pork loin dish with an amazing gravy and a pasta dish and both were very good. The restaurant is medium sized with dark lighting and a bar. Very clean and cozy. To top it all off, our waitress brought us a complimentary slice of their cheesecake at the end since it was our first time in. For sure, it won't be our last!

We went Friday night and it was out of this world.
Food was fantastic - service even better.
We particularly likes the halibut and scallops.
We are from southern California and so tiered of fighting the strip - plus paying their prices.  This wonderful restaurant has it all - a must go!  
Special thanks to Stephanie!

It is hard to give a restaurant 5 stars but from the food to the service they deserve it. Everything that I have ordered has been great. Everything that my friends have ordered has been great. The people make you feel at home. I hope this place does well. Las Vegas needs more restaurants like this.

I dragged my boyfriend to Southern Highlands so he could try the food for himself.  He got the chicken parm and I got baked salmon on a bed of warm quinoa.  Just fantastic.  On top of that, the waitress gifted us a slice of their AMAZING cheesecake since he was a newbie.  I will definitely be coming back!!!

Just go!
Take a break from the "chain" places and the overpriced Las Vegas Strip ... you will be very happy at Zest Bistro!
Come "home" to a great meal and the friendliest folks in the business! When you walk into Zest, you know you've arrived at a special place. There is no better service in the city than what you'll experience with Donna - she's the best! You will be pleasantly surprised by Donna's upbeat and happy to see you hospitality - martinis - lemon drops - raspberry - always perfectly crafted. Jessie backs up the bar with a friendly smile and an aim to please attitude and makes an amazing Sangria. The wine by the glass menu is impressive - many favorites!
The expansive menu offerings cover all the bases, without compromising any one item. Gourmet Italian seafood entrees, traditional but not ordinary lasagna (amazing!), Happy Hour specials, pizza and flatbreads, chicken dishes, chops and steaks ... the best Caesar salad dressing (we try to remember to take an order of dressing home - it's that good!).
Save room for cheesecake!
Not fancy, just fan-tastic! Relax in casual excellence and enjoy reasonably priced meals with something for everyone and they even include the salad! That's the Zest way.
Amazing food and even better service! Chicken stuffed scampi, rolled New York, and the caesar are amazing! Highly recommend!
went to the other location on Trop and Grand Canyon.  not as good.  the menu wasn't as vast either.

I wanted to try something new closer to home so I figured we'll try this place. We were greeted by the most adorable 6 year old hostess and we're seated right away even though they were pretty busy. I ordered some Calamari for appetizers and it was very bland even with the sauce. I ordered their Surf and Turf special for my main course and although my filet was very tender and cooked perfect it lacked flavor. The scallops that came with it was delicious. For dessert, I had their rice pudding which was horrible, it tasted like paper, not even the cinnamon on top helped the taste. All in all I think it was overpriced. My husband only had vegetables since he's a vegan and we still paid close to $200. I would be paying the same amount at the Capital Grille, better food, better ambiance and awesome wine selection. The only thing I liked at this place is the service. Our waitress was very attentive and had an awesome personality. Don't think I will be going back. I guess that's what happens when you try some place new. Disappointment!

MUST GO!!

The restaurant is located...you guessed right...off the strip.  About a 10-15 mins drive or $80 taxi ride (round trip) from the Strip.  Your amazing dinning experience starts when you walk in to the counter in front of the open kitchen.  You can order from the menu on the board overhead or next to you, or Tom can help you.  Then, find a seat at the tables or sit by the bar and let the great food comes to you.  I don't think you can order anything wrong from them.  The food is very well prepared--just real food as its namesake.  The wine list and the beer variety are very extensive for the restaurant of its size.  There are 2 deserts offered--cheesecake and rice pudding.  I had the cheesecake and it was the BEST ever, even on full stomach.  It was creamy and light---perfect ending to a perfect meal.

I didn't mention anything about service.  I didn't feel like I was being served--I felt like I was having dinner in my friends' kitchen table.  If I live in Vegas, Off The Strip-Just Real Food would be my restaurant of choice for our monthly gathering.

This is the perfect place to enjoy great food, great wine and great company.  Don't miss out on this hidden gem of Vegas.
Excellent food and service. Make a reservation or they will fill up. Yanni our server was fast, knowledgeable and friendly. Amount of food was greatj delcious! We are coming back.

Meh, I can make better food at home.

All in all, I don't really think I'll be going to back to Off the Strip.  I ate here about six years ago and decided to give it another try.  The service is good and the server is friendly.  She is knowledgeable about the menu, but I would say her description about the taste is way off.  We ordered the crab cakes to start.  They were a huge miss and I got some shell in mine.  As for the entrees, I ordered a wedge salad and the kabobs.  My father ordered some type of mess of a chicken dish.  Anyway, the wedge salad was sad.  I could tell they had all the right ingredients, but it felt amateurish.  Also, the kabob was a bit bland.  As I started with, the food is okay, but I know I can make it better at home.  This place really isn't worth going to.  I would rather go to the Italian place right next to it.

Wow, what a disappointment. I've had this restaurant hyped up in my head soooo much, thanks to friends and family. We were celebrating a birthday so we had a party of 12.
Walking into the restaurant, there's no dedicated hostess, hostess stand, so you walk in lost. While the other patrons of the restaurant just look at you awkwardly smiling. I was greeted by a nice random guy in a tshirt and hat talking to some of his friends at the bar. I'm going to assume he's the owner/manager.
Once my party was there, we were sat at picnic folding tables which means if you're sitting at the end, your feet have no where to go. The service was a mix of okay and terrible. Our server was a loud,
 exciting, bald gentlemen who did a good job with being attentive to our needs. When he got to me, I ordered the Beef Wellington because I've been told how amazing it is by my friends and by him. I asked, because it doesn't say on the menu, if the potatoes that come with this dish have pork/bacon in them because I religiously don't eat pork. He said they do, and he'll sub for something else. When I got my meal, I received a double order of zucchini and my beef Wellington. I said, no biggie, I had enough bread anyways. Half way through my first piece of "Medium-Well" Wellington (ordered Medium) I tasted bacon. So I asked our server, is there bacon in the Wellington? He said he doesn't know. But he'll find out. Shocking he doesn't know the proteins in a single dish that's the most expensive thing on the menu. He came back very sorry saying, yes, there is bacon in Wellington. He apologized and apologized and said he'll take it off the check. I decided not to reorder, and eat of my friends' plates. When we got the check, the Wellington was still on my bill. I'm not one to argue about paying, but that's ridiculous. The server screwed up when he was well aware of what I couldn't eat, the owner screwed up by not putting this on the menu, and it totally ruined this high expectation restaurant for me. I wasn't looking for a free meal, but with that kind of mess up, I'm shocked that this restaurant didn't take it upon themselves to do the right thing and hold themselves accountable for their own mistake. And not hold the customer accountable for something that wasn't told by the server and not said on the menu.

I almost cried when I took my first bite out of their famous Rigatoni alla Vodka with giant meatball.  Yeah, it tasted that good to me.  al dante! 

Pork Roulade was pretty good too.  

Their homemade cheesecake was just as crazy delicious.  

I need to go back soon...
Not the same when Donna is not here. She MAKES the places!!! Food is good but it's the people and we come here for Donna!

The restaurant has it made.  They have regular clientele, a great menu, nice specials, and good service.  The food is great, but it wasn't something that I was going crazy over.  When I stop in to places that have such a rave reputation, I truly expect to be blown away in terms of flavor and creativity.  Their bread service is fantastic, their appetizers are delicious, and my steak was cooked perfectly.

If I had to say one negative, it was the seasoning on my steak.  I don't like a curry-like flavor on steak, and for some reason the seasoning had that taste.  Other than that, it was good food.

It's delicious food and great atmosphere. I prefer to sit at the bar than at the tables. It's definitely the perfect spot in Southern Highlands. I recommend asking about the secret menu. Pretty bomb dishes off there. And the cheesecake is amazing!!
This place is a hidden gem! Had the best time - food was great, drinks were bomb, and the service was excellent. Donna and James are the best! Highly recommend :)

I've been meaning to yelp this place for a long time now, I've been eating here for four months. My roommates have been eating here about a year. Everyone loves it! I must say this food blows away the Olive Garden which in my opinion is a compliment. I started off on a bad note here because the firts time I ever came here I was picking it up as a 'to-go" order. It took about 25-30 minutes over how long it was supposed to take. They seemed very busy so I sat around and waited, they seemed very disorganzied with the way the orders are placed. The two people who were running things didn't seem to commincate very well. 

#2 experience,
Very different, getting ready to fly home to California. Decided to grab a bite before my flight we sat at the bar, drinking beers waiting for our yummy italian dishes to come out. The bartender was such a character, he was witty and gave us alot to talk about which really made my night. And he gave us beer for free, what a chill dude. 

I really like Off The Strip. 

It's been nothing but excellent. I always order the same thing because I'm so happy I found my perfect meal. Spaghetti with Sausage and Softball Meatball, Bacon wrapped Filet Mignon, and the house salad comes for free. Cheesecake is a must for dessert, and believe me I'm very, very, very picky about cheesecake. It's good enough to cheat on a diet for! 

Tucked away from all the touristy spots around the strip, this place is a growing family operated establishment, locals loves this cooking. I guess I am one of locals now.

We went here from my cousin's recommendation it's down the street from his townhouse where we stay at when we're in Vegas. It's casual atmosphere with fine dining type of italian food!! The owners are from brooklyn they're great and super hospitable and just great overall service!

Some Positives: We ate for dinner the first night we arrived I ordered lobster ravoli it was delicious with great chunks of lobster you can totally taste it, it tasted fresh and authentic! My cousin custom ordered crab cakes on pasta with vodka sauce it was awesome all crab crab cake delicious!! My bf ordered spaghetti and meatballs and it was so yummy moist and flavorful!! We enjoyed dinner and was stuffed!! Large servings of pasta are hard to finish. The owner was teasing us for not finishing our dinner and happily packed it up and was just as great as leftovers! Dinner was fine dining quality and was of great value under $15.

We came back for sunday brunch and let me tell you I didn't think a restaurant could get any better!! I ordered creme brulee french toast and I've had this before and really doubted it could be found somewhere else and they blew the other restaurant out of the water!! It was great tasted exactly like creme brulee!! But I would recommend getting the maple syrup on the side it can get too sweet. But I loved it and I loved the price it cost $7.50!!! And as usual we were greeted with a warm good morning and offered free drinks I got my fill of mimosas!! Yummmm!!

My cousin may start working there that might be even better!! Great place a must try don't judge a restaurant by it's strip mall location!! 

Some Negative: it's in Vegas and the pasta is too good to resist I may be a fat whale glad it's in Vegas then!!

The food here is truly fantastic. My favorite person here is Donna. She just has a way of making you feel at home. Donna has a  wonderful personality, but it's that smile of hers that just makes your day!

Living in So Highlands I wanted to see what the hype was about. I ordered the meatloaf for takeout. Fresh vegetables & mash potatoes came with it. I agree with many reviews stating the overuse of garlic. Just a bit too much for my taste. Garlic has its place but too much isn't a good thing. Gravy seemed very salty. I'll try it again maybe the chicken parmigiana.

Tried this place out for the first time and was very impressed.  The food was EXCELLENT! We had a large party, so we were able to try out a decent chunk of the menu.  Where this place really stands out is their steak (the ribeye was amazing!) and cheesecake.  This is quite possibly the best cheesecake in Vegas.  The calamari was really good as well, the sauce is what does it.  

Atmosphere is fairly plain, bar type.  For the price of the food, I was expecting a more comfortable, upscale bistro. 

All in all -  Food was delicious.  Atmosphere was unimpressive. Price was higher than expected. Most entrees were in the $30 range.

My dad and I have been here a few times, more when it was "Off the strip." We went in December of 2017 and then tonight. Back in December it was my dad, Sister, best friend and myself. I remember my best friend having the spaghetti and meatballs and I had the "wit calzone" I remember it not being so great. To be fair I don't remember why exactly but I was thoroughly underwhelmed with our food. 

Tonight Dad and I went again. Dad had the ribeye with house salad and I had the gnocchi Ragu with Caesar salad and we shared a meatball as an appetizer.  The meatballs are HUGE, pretty good and have a slight spice to them. Overall delicious. I can't speak for dads meal. My gnocchi were pretty mushy. I usually don't order gnocchi since it can frequently be "wall paper paste." It wasn't terrible, I ate my whole plate, but I was less than thrilled. The sauce and sausage was delicious and probably why I finished my plate. 

The service was great and they were quick to refill my water and iced tea right away. At the end of the meal Dad said "this place is a pretty solid spot." So he likes it. But I told him I wasn't thrilled with it and that I felt it was sub par. I can't speak for the pricing since Dad always picks up the tab. The place isn't terrible, the service is great but I think the food frequently falls short. I don't plan on being back any time soon but I think Dad will.
First time here! The food was delicious? The lobster ravioli! The bartender was very absolutly friendly and helpful! I will defenetly come back to try out the food!

They call it Off the Strip, but it should be called Off the Strip with Strip Prices!!  Party of 2 and we ordered 2 glasses of wine, 2 cocktails, and 2 entrees.  The bill....$85 plus tip!!!  I have no idea how it could possibly have been that expensive without some sort of error, but I did not feel like getting into that conversation with the bartender (we sat at the bar) as the service was already kind of slow.  Ambiance is weird.  It is in a strip mall.  When you walk in the door, you walk right into the middle of the dining room and there is not a hostess stand.  That is awkward.  If you stand waiting for someone to seat you, you end up standing right over another table.  So I guess there is no one to seat you, which is how we ended up at the bar.  The decor is very random and inconsistent.  Food was very good.  We ordered the chicken and artichoke dish and the stuffed chicken with cheese and veggies dish.  Service at the bar was okay.  All in all, very good food, mediocre service, poor ambiance, and outrageously overpriced.  Would not go back.

My husband and I have eaten here several times.  Every visit has been tasty!  The portions are pretty good, so I have leftovers for lunch (my husband manages to finish his).  We have had steak, chicken, fish, pasta, and meatballs.  We've been going since they first opened and although its fun to see all the changes success has brought to them, the expansion is not quite the same as the original area.  Hopefully they will make it a bit more intimate in that section.  We have not had the desserts - ever - because we are too full.  But why haven't we been offered a free slice of cheesecake?  LOL.  Maybe next time.  We recommend this place often, and enjoy taking friends and family here.  I would recommend a reservation for busy times or nights, especially holidays.  Great food, great service, very casual and laid back but tasty.  Enjoy!
Food was good, just not great in my perspective .  Staff was nice, but they are all seem to be high school kids, so not real polished.   I probably wouldn't eat here again.

Went there on a Monday night, it was the worst meal I've had in ages. We waited 10 minutes to get some water, asked for bread 4 times. We ordered the tomato caprese salad which was 4 slices of a supermarket plum tomato and 4 slices of past its prime tough mozzerella on 4 basil leaves for $12.50. It was not worth $3. We ordered from the light menu. Pork chops tough, not cooked to order and tasteless. It was supposed to have lemon butter, both were AWOL. The penne pasta with chicken was terrible. The pasta was first overcooked then let to dry out under a heat lamp, light on the chicken. This place did not live up to its highly touted reputation.  We waited 35 minutes for the main course after we finally ordered. Service was extremely slow, the bus boy and the waitress barely acknowledged us. We will not be going back.
Great choice if you want something not from a mega casino. The food was tasty and fresh and the staff was friendly. BTW - portions are huge!

Food was ok...I had gnocchi ragu and my husband had the gyro/steak sandwich.  Get the Caesar salad unless you like yard waste as a house salad.  Calamari appetizer was really good.  Had to ask for bread.  This was our first time.....and we are NOT coming back....way too expensive for a "local" restaurant.

Great food and fantastic service from Stephanie. Had the gnocchi ragu and everything was good except the sausage was just a weird touch. Would have been bettter sans meat IMO. Would definitely return, my parents live in the area and come here often.

Always my favorite go to restaurant. We've been coming here for years and it's never had a dull moment here. Their menu is an Italian with a twist and they have a great drink selection.
