My favorite thing on their menu is their penne alla vodka because their sauce is made from scratch everyday. They also have these meatballs that I kid you not are 2 pounds and they are to die for. They have anything from pasta to pork chops there is a huge selection so everyone can pick something they love

Their staff is the sweetest people ever. We love Yianni, Nicole, Stephanie, and the owner Billy they are the sweetest family ever. 

Overall best restaurant because of the people and the atmosphere and most importantly the food!

I know the locals prize this place for its down-home feel and non-Vegas Strip, earthy ambience. But quite frankly, the food -- while certainly tasty -- was over-priced and its location in a deserted open-plan mall gave me the willies. I think the two of us chalked up a near $100 check that evening.

Great spot, excellent food, fantastic service, we hit up this spot on a weekday for dinner . Full bar, you could dress up or casual dress, kids are welcome menu to please everyone (mostly Italian) good portions . Can't say anything bad about this place,  we'll be a returning customers!  Stephanie was our server , she was more than good!

Great food & service!  We came here for a girls night out and everyone was happy with their meal. We agreed that we'd return for a future gno. We started with an appetizer...balsamic marinated steak which was filled with an asparagus and topped with a delicious gravy and tasty greens.  I had the chicken stuffed with shrimp scampi on top of angel hair pasta and a perfectly dressed, garlicky Caesar salad. This was one of those dishes that gets better with every bite $25.  The portions were quite generous too! I'll definitely be back!!  This would definitely be a great date night or family night out (with polite, well mannered kiddos of course:))

This place is why I have gained so much weight since moving to vegas. Wife and I both love eating here, everything on the menu is great and the staff treats you like a regular even when its your first time there.
Lobster Ravioli and Chimay Beer... enough said! kudos to the adorable decor and amazing service! i recommend the place to everyone.

The weekend brunch is amazing. Great flavors and setting for everyone. The service is great (thanks James). The atmosphere is relaxed and the food really is the best. Lots of options and unique combinations!

Hidden local gem. Menu has a great selection of different menu options all delicious! Ate at the bar and Jesse is very helpful, charming, charismatic and made a lot of great suggestion! End with the cheesecake
I loved the fall off the bone ribs. Their NY Steak was the best, and the Shrimp Scampi was just delicious!!!

Holy smokes! Walked in for a cup of soup. This place was packed on a Tuesday night and I had to sit at the bar...anyway, the bartender Donna was beyond accommodating, delightful and full of energy with every customer (just thought it was me). Um, it gets better. I met Margaret, Eric and Cathy (Margaret's mother). So, soup of the night was chicken tortilla...cup?! Full bowl! After that amazing experience was the 2 lbd meatball!! So delicious!!! See pictures, enough said!! After that followed with REAL NY cheesecake, light...high & fluffy as it should be.
Tortellini was absolutely delicious!  Great service and exceptional food make this place one of Las Vegas' BEST!!!

Holy cow did I have a bad day and I needed my fix of good food and tasty drinks. Off the Strip was the answer. I sat at the bar and was greeted by Jack. Jack saw my need for a drink and poured the most yummy tempranillo. Then he gave his suggestions for yummy appetizers. 

They were all great but the ones that stuck out the most were the Rolled New York and the Thai Chili Bacon Wrapped Prawns. Plus...they carried my favorite dessert sake...Star Rabbit. 

I am eternally grateful to Off the Strip and Jack for turning my frown upside down. Will be coming back here often.

This is a great place! The food is delicious and the people are wonderful. We were greeted by the sweetest hostess, Sophie, and from her welcome I knew it would be a great place and I wasn't wrong. We had the chicken parm sandwich and the gyro cheesesteak sandwich. Both were tasty! We shared the cheesecake I read so many reviews about---it lives up to the hype!

We will absolutely be back!

My husband and I have been going to Zest for years. It's like our kitchen away from home, but they cook way better than we do. All the staff here are so friendly and make you feel welcome every time you walk in! Miguel, Donna, Stephanie - everyone there is fantastic and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu. We especially love the lasagna and their cheesecake is the best in the city.

Zest has to be one of the best italian restaurants in the city of Las Vegas . It's family owned and the service is impeccable. Jesse is the bartender and he will keep you laughing and smiling. He is very attentive and helpful on picking out food and drinks. This was my first time eating here and I will be back. The owner is amazing and is hands on. He will come introduce himself shakes hands and checks to see how the food was. This is the place to take your family or just a intimate date with your significant other. Please give this place a try. It's a must at least once a month.

5 stars!!!!

I head to Vegas roughly once a month for whether it be for business or pleasure, and my girlfriend and I decided to do something different than we are completely used to... Which was to eat away from all the casinos and the strip.  She left it up to me to find something, and I had no idea where to go.  I decided to YELP where my next dinner was going to be, and I came up with this place.  

Upon entering the complex, you have this feeling of,"Really?!? THIS PLACE is rated this high? There must be a mistake."  It was getting late, and we were starving.  We went in.  

The atmosphere was perfect for a "date-night."  There's a bar that's social on the right, and there were tables intimate enough on the left.  The view into the kitchen also sets this place apart.

I ordered the Pork Chops, and the girlfriend ordered the Liguine with Clams.  We paired that with a Russian River Pinot, and finished it their homemade Cheesecake.  The food was delicious; flavor and taste in EVERY bite.

All in all, an Amazing night.  We ended up speaking to Billy, and we found out we are from the same area in San Francisco.  Billy and the staff were awesome, polite, and top-notch in terms of overall class.  I will recommend this place to anyone who wants a change of pace from the "always-the-same" atmosphere on the strip. 

Thanks for the night guys!
I have eaten here a number of times. The food is always excellent and plenty. Service is personal, friendly and efficient. One of my favorite local places.
Just went there for drinks. The food they were serving looked good.  The service was great! Donna's the best!

Went there Monday 8/12/13 with a party of 8 for my birthday dinner.  I wish I could give more than 2 stars because the food was amazing.  BUT the service was probably the worst I've had in a while.  We were seating at our reserved time, but once we started to order our drinks, those were all messed up and drinks weren't brought out.  Then we got to ordering our appetizers and entrees 20 minutes after we were sat.  It took 40 minutes (8pm) to get our salads and app's, then it took another 45 minutes (8:45pm) for our entrees to come out.

I would understand if the place was busy, but it was really only half way full.  

Spaghetti and meatballs were amazing. Meatballs are probably the best in town.  But the bad service made everything unenjoyable.  And I hate when I have to repeatedly ask for refills.
Great food period.  It is constantly packed and for good reason.

Saturday night about 6, my wife and I were greeted right away and allowed to choose our own seat. The water and menus reached table quickly. The staff were very friendly and on top of there game. While we were waiting, we saw Floyd Mayweather come in with his crew. They sat at the bar and there was no ruckus. 
My wife ordered chicken parmesan and I ordered the meatloaf. Each came with a salad. We also ordered calamari as an appetizer. While we ate our salads, bread was brought to the table it was warm and crusty but lacked flavor. 
The calamari was among the best I have ever eaten in my life. The texture was perfect. The batter was flavorful and it came out nice and hot. The dipping sauce complimented the calamari without overpowering it. 
My wife's chicken dish was HUGE! A huge chicken breast fried to perfection covered in cheese on top of a bed of angel hair pasta. The sauce hot hot and full of flavor. 
The meatloaf was very tender and had different layers of flavor. I was a little disappointed with the mashed potatoes. They were instant potatoes. The same type I make at home. I like them, I just have higher expectation from a restaurant that serves amazing calamari. The gravy over the meatloaf tasted like it was from a package as well. It was ok, but again, I have higher expectations from a restaurant like this. 
We took some rice pudding home and were very pleased with it. 
Our meal came to, just over $56. There are several other thing on the menu I would like to try. I just hope things are a little more homemade and fresh.

I've only had the fettucine alfredo from here, as honestly I'm a very picky eater and that was really only the dish on the main menu I'd eat!  Definitely a bit fancier of a menu, which is great for most people, but not for a plain Jane like me.  The alfredo was good, but nothing too stellar to really stand out from it from any other restaurant.  The dish that stood out though was the cheesecake!  Best I've ever had!  At $6.50 a slice, its kinda expensive like everything else on the menu, but I'll definitely be back for more!

My husband and I love this place, we know since we used to live in S.H
Everything you eat is delicious, they always make you feel welcome.

Great food, and great service.  I really can't say enough good things about the food.  We had the bruschetta as an appetizer; I had the chicken tristina; and my husband had eggplant parmesan.  All were delicious.  And we finished our meal with the amazing, rich and creamy cheesecake.  I'd give it 5 stars, but my only complaint would be the tiny 2 top table in the back we ended up with.  I can't really complain much though because we showed up on a very busy Saturday night with no reservations and they managed to squeeze us in.

Excellent beef Wellington.  They have a different location in summerlin that has some amazing appetizers I wish they would get in sohi.  The sohi location does have a new side item which is to die for, truffled Mac n cheese.  I used to go to smith & wollensky on the strip just for this dish.  Now the chef from wollensky is working at off the strip sohi so we should see more positive changes

I have been here about 10 times, it has a pretty solid menu selection and the food quality is good.  It lost some of the character when they expanded on both sides, however, it is a lot less wait time to get a table. Some the best menu items are the Caesar salad and the cheesecake is by far the best thing there.  I will definitely be back.  A little on the high side price wise.

Love this place! Just moved to the area and this is for sure going to be our new neighborhood go to spot. Healthy menu, great drinks and super friendly staff. Highly recommend! Get  the  cheese  cake . Donna Rocks!
The meatball was awesome! Good food and good drinks. Our server Jesse was awesome too, super funny!

My wife and I came in one Saturday evening thinking it was a steak restaurant.  Surprise, its Italian.  Food was good, but a bit pricey.  Cocktails were also good.  Service was ok.  Not sure why 1/3 of the restaurant was unused.  There are many good restaurants in this Southern Highlands Plaza.  I'm just not sure this is the best for the price.

Just got off the plane from Phoenix to see my hubby and we went to our favorite neighborhood restaurant, Zest, with amazing service by Jesse!! Love love love this place and Jesse's service!! Very grateful!!

Donna recommended the Salmon + Grilled Asparagus. Tasted awesome and didn't have to wait long!  

Great local spot.  I will come back.

Have been here quite a few times and love the food and the cheesecake. No question one of southern highlands best places to grab a great bite and a good drink. I always stay at the bar and Jesse and Donna are the best!!!!

Food was good! but very slow service. I have to ask for my salad twice. I ended up taking it to go. No a good non- alcoholic drinks options, not even regular ice tea. Fountain drinks only...:/. The place is kinda small, dark and tight. Not much else I can say about it, but I don't think I'll eat here again, unless is for to go.

Ate there one year ago and it was fabulous...so when I came back to town I had to return... And I.wasn't disappointed!  The steak and eggs were as good as I remembered and the Bloody Marys are to die for.  This is my favorite breakfast place in Vegas!  Eight miles from the Strip? Worth the trip.

Best place in Vegas!  Get the pork roulade as an appetizer.  Best ever!  We hit the timing right to get a table.  Great wine selection.  I had the Chef's signature pasta with all kinds of stuff in it!  My partner had the meatloaf which was also fantastic.  Busy place, but watching the action in the kitchen is like watching a great, well-oiled machine!  I hear that the cheesecake is good...but I had no room!  WONDERFUL!  DO NOT MISS OUT ON THIS FANTASTIC PLACE!  It is in a strip mall, but....you know what they say about books and covers!

Best Alfredo I've ever had! Service was great as well came in for a bite as I was craving pasta and I was not disappointed.  My son had linguine and clams and that was delish as well. Ask for Stephanie she was amazing!
1st time in and I will be back.  Stacie was an awesome bartender.   She made us some amazing handmade margaritas.  Try the rolled New York and ragu sauce
So glad we finally went here because the food and service was amazing! A+ Stephanie! Cant wait to go back for the lobster ravioli, chicken parmesan, and cheesecake. That food was delicious.
I absolutely love this restaurant!! I have been coming here for years and Donna is the best  she knows what my drink is

Tonight on a return trip my husband had the meatloaf (comfort food when raining). He said it was the best meatloaf he had ever had! The bartender offered a complimentary cheesecake (since we had never tried it before) and let me tell you.., save room for the cheesecake! Another yummy experience! Wine selection is exceptional for a local place!
Service was a little slow and the chairs are a little hard but the food is great and the decor is cool

I try to eat a different entrée and appetizer, my go. I'm never disappointed in the quality of the food the superb service and a friendly hello from the owner Billy.The cheesecake is to die for the house salad dressing is delicious, the salads agree, the beef Wellington I highly recommend.

Love this place!  This is our favorite restaurant in Vegas.  For the past few years we've been coming here every time we're in town.  The scampi stuffed chicken is the BEST, we also really like the lasagna and beef stroganoff.  A big shout out to Stephanie, our waitress when we stopped in last month.  She's a fellow Akronite now living in Vegas - very friendly.  We've always had great food and great service here.  My only complaint is that the portions are so big you don't have room for dessert, and their cheesecake is the best I ever had.  They need a few entrees with smaller portions for those of us with a sweet tooth - just sayin.
This is actually my first here. My daughter took me out to dinner. At Zest- Bistro. The  employees are cordial. Our server, Miguel is spectacular....great food... great ambiance. Highly recommended.

Entree dishes are great with large portions. not overly fond of the side salads. Too pricey for everyday dining and the ambience is lacking. They tout their tasteless cheesecake, while not horrible, I have had much better at a lot of places for less money.

Went in for brunch! What a good time and great food. The bartender/manager was SUPER helpful and overall just a sweet person. She provided warm service. $ mimosas and bloody Mary's! Yum! The mimosa was too sweet for me so she got me something else right away. It's all you can eat little portions of the menu. Kinda like brunch tapas. It would be a fantastic place to take the family or a group of friends. We almost left because it was so empty, I'm So glad we stayed.

I've been wanting to try this spot out for a long time now. I'm glad I finally got around to it. Food was top notch from the salad to the Wellington. My drink was always full, which is a sign of their attentive service. Oh and let me not forget to mention their decadent cheesecake which our server offered for free coz it was my first visit. I think I could see myself being a regular lol
Love love love this place!!  Food is amazing! Service is great!  My favorite restaurant in Vegas!
Food was great and the staff was quick an attentive! Really enjoyed my dinner at this place!

The boyfriend and I came into Off the Strip when we were looking to try something different for dinner. We were seated and then greeted by who I think was the owner. He asked us if we had been there before and we said "no" and he said "I wish I wasn't leaving right now because I would give you a food tour." He still gave us a detailed tour of the menu and some of their specialties. Stephanie was our server and she was so friendly. We ordered the orange roughy and substituted the pasta for sautéed spinach and a potato pancake and the spaghetti with Italian sausage and a meatball the size of a softball. Our entrees came with salads and we both ordered Caesar salads. They were so good. Freshly tossed and great flavor. The portions here are huge. I ended up taking half my food home and got two more meals out of the leftovers. Such great food and service. Check out the specials chalk board by the kitchen. We will definitely be back.

Great service phenomenal food. Best Wellington I had so far in Vegas! 
Go see Pauli he is the perfect host!

I've been coming here for since it was a small place that only served beer & wine. They've expanded, and now serve a full bar and also have a room in the back for cigar smokers. What a difference a couple years makes. The food has been consistently good, after the expansion, service was a bit iffy but it seems they have pulled it together. These happen to be a few of my favorites:

1. Really Trashy "Garbage" Salad, mixed greens, salami, Provolone cheese, shrimp, capers, hearts of palm, cherry peppers, and mushrooms in balsamic vinaigrette & a big mound of bleu cheese crumbles. Hand down BEST vinaigrette I've had.

2. Spaghetti Squash over Pasta, spaghetti squash with fresh Rroma tomatoes, garlic,
onions, basil and Parmesan cheese on spaghetti. 

3. Chicken & Artichokes (this is my favorite protein dish)

4.Chicken Tristina, A breast of chicken stuffed with grilled vegetables and mozzarella cheese on penne aglio olio con broccoli. 

5. Beef Wellington, this blows Smith & Wollensky away, can't even touch it.

6. Lobster Ravioli. Need I say more?

All entrees come with a house salad with my favorite dressing. For dessert you have to try Chef Al's NY cheesecake. This will ruin you for any cheesecake after you try this. The rice pudding is also a favorite of mine.
Great menu!   Food was excellent.  Had 2 fish dishes and were served hot, done and tasty.  Good server.  Met the owner.  Nice gentleman.  Only drawback was thought prices a little high.  Will go back

I love this place!  Its such a little gem...great food, great service, great quality! Right in my neighborhood!     Try the 2 pound meatball and the Caesar salad...you won't be sorry. I love that I can get such amazing meal  at a local spot!

So, I have eaten here before and previously given positive reviews, however tonight was a different story. I will say that the server was courteous and nice, but food and pricing was a different story. First off, the wedge salad was actually made with a half head of cabbage, to remake it took approximately 12 minutes. Second we ordered 2 "Mother of all burgers" which apparently for $12 don't include any toppings. When ordered the server stated, "want those loaded?" To which we answered, "yes." Which actually turned out to mean that they add on $8 in toppings turning it into a $20 burger. Not worth your time, drive north 3 minutes to Distill.

So, I've received two responses to this review which I will post below. Just to clarify the prices may be stated on the menu and I'm not disputing that. However, when you order something and the server says, "Loaded? Do you want everything on that?" I think most reasonable people assume they're not going to get a 60% up charge. And as for quality, it was ok, not great, not bad by any means. Anyhow, I'll let you all judge based on employee responses.

One word, amazing! My fiancé and I were visiting Las Vegas for our first time ever and wanted to find a reasonably priced Bistro/Bar, which is not easy in Vegas! Our waiter was easily one of the most pleasant waiters we've ever experienced....very friendly and welcoming. The food was cooked to perfection and tasted amazing. Don't let the exterior first impression scare away your date guys, as it does appear to be VERY much like a drinking type of pub from the outside.

Had the beef Wellington which was very tasty but not worth the $36.00 price tag! The steak my wife had was a bit over cooked as compared to what she ordered. Service was really great! Didn't make reservations, so had to sit at the bar. Lots of other people had the same problem. With the amount of people in this restaurant and to only have a one person bathroom is crazy!

The scampi stuffed chicken here is so good! It was well seasoned and paired with thin spaghetti that had the most delicious sauce. I also enjoyed their calamari. Food portions are huge and could easily be shared.  Service was on point! They brought us our bread and butter within minutes after taking our order, the drinks were refilled immediately, and our main order was served just right on time.  I would definitely come back here again!

Calamaris- the boom! amazing from the start
Salmon Rissoto- OMG! I give it a 10+ delicious
services excelent! Miguel was funny and very attentative.
My fiancé and I had an amzaing dinner date.

Excellent service, even though it was a busy Saturday. At our table we ordered Beef Stroganoff,  the special pork chops, and the Chicken Saltimbucco. All was amazing, including the cheesecake. I highly recommend this place!
Loved the food and the people. My husband and I enjoyed the lasagne and Alfredo. They were both amazing.

Been extremely positive because the food and people were extremely good. Not so much this time. Went back on Dec 24 expecting the usual good vibes. Not there, place felt different. Neither of the bosses were there but, more important, there must have been a different "chef" because the food was just not acceptable. Sausage appetizer was delicious so all was well in this barren corner of Vegas. I tried the linguini in white clam sauce. Incredible, there were no fresh clams, just bits of clams probably from a can, and not enough garlic to bother a vampire. My wife's dish consisted of a large meatball which was really underwhelming, and a good sausage and passable pasta. Place was never cheap but always a good value when the food was up. A 20 minute drive to this backwater and poor food for $100 with corkage is NOT a good or even acceptable value. As far as I'm concerned Off the Strip will remain a freeway too far for my return. Sad, value restaurants are really hard to find.

Thanks to many posts online, we stopped for dinner on the
way back from a day of outlet shopping in Primm.
The food is excellent and the service super friendly.
Some of the best food we had all week on vacation.
I was doubtful when we pulled up because they're in a
non-descript supermarket strip mall near the southern
edge of town, but the food delivers.  Highly recommended.

I chose this restaurant, because of all the views it had on yelp.  I was surprised to see this place in a strip mall.  The food there was amazing.  All though we had 3 different servers ... the service was really good.  The food was amazing.  The Cesar salad was a bit on the spicy side.  Not too sure what made it a lil spicy.  The cheesecake was delicious doe desert.  They even give you chocolate, carmel & strawberry to dip it in.  The pasta was amazing.  I loved the cream and it wasn't dry.  Usually I can never get enough sauce with my pasta.  It tasted like it was homemade recipe.

A friend and I had dinner here last night. The food was delicious! I got the scampi stuffed chicken, and my friend got the daily special scallops. The service was excellent, and they gave us a free slice of cheesecake for dessert since it was our first time. My only complaints are that the prices are a bit steep, and the chairs are pretty hard and uncomfortable. However, as I mentioned before, the staff are incredible, and the food is really good. Off the Strip is worth a try, and I'll definitely be back.

So i guess i fall into the group of people wo just recently went and couldnt figure out what all the hype was. My expectations were also set high by the reviews that i have read, not to mention the fact that i expect an experience when i dine out since i am paying for a meal out. 
Upon arrival i was wondering if i was in the right place, as the strip mall location wasnt what threw me off but more the way the place felt when i entered through the door. Tv's on the walls with the football game on, with a chalkboard menu on the wall above the kitchen area and only a dining room of 8 tables with not even a table cloth on the table. I dont know about you guys but if im spending $20+ a plate for a dinner i dont need to feel like im eating at a tavern. People actually leave the stip to come to this place? Okay enough about the location. 
This great service that everybody was talking about... where was it? I contacted the restaurant previously because i wanted to see if lasagna was ever on the menu as a daily special since this is something that i really like to order when im out. This was something that was made available which i was pleased with, no doubt. After that bit of service i had nothing else of the sort that was welcoming or made me feel as if i absolutely had to come back because this restaurant was on the top of its game on service. My server was a young man who although didnt do a bad job, didnt do anything extrodinary that made me want to return as honestly this is a big deal to me when i dine out. If the service is on point and welcoming chances are i will return. 
Now the food... the pre-dinner bread or lack there of. Was brought out a small bowl with 5 slivers (yes 1/8 inch slivers of a hard baguette as bread felt more like it was croutons for my overly dressed salad, which wasnt a bad house salad but just too heavily drenched in dressing. On to my lasagna which when it came out was VERY small which i felt, alright if this is making up in taste for what it lacks in portion ill be okay. Yeah, that wasnt the case my noodles were overcooked where it had to be cut with a knife. The sauce was just okay and the only nice part about it that differed from my own that i make at home was that Italian sausage was used in place of ground beef which im a fan of. But i still stopped for a snack on the way home because i was still hungry after my meal because my portion was lacking. 
I was looking for a place to replace my Italian restaurant that was recently closed for remodel at the Monte Carlo Casino, it was called the Market City Caffe. This was a place where the service was second to none, the food was excellent and the price points were right in line with what Off the Strip is offering. BUT i always left satisfied, always felt like they appreciated my business and i enjoyed my dining experience. For anybody visiting Vegas and thinks they should take the drive, save your time and effort and dine ON THE STRIP as its not worth the drive.

Italian boyfriend means one thing, Italian food! This restaurant definitely requires a reservation, as it is small and busy. The interior was very relaxing and set a positive tone for our meal.

From the moment we walked in the door the customer service was amazing. With a family of waitresses and waiters constantly checking up on us. The food was a little expense but the portions were huge! I got the chicken parmigiana and I could have easily shared it with another person.

Overall a great atmosphere and great food. I would recommend this restaurant to those that like Italian food, and are prepared for some great service.

Our first visit will not be our last.  The service impeccable.  We ordered chicken wings appetizer.  So finger licking good.  Our entree was salmon special sitting on top of zucchini.  The other chicken saltimacca
Perfection.  The French bread and Caesar salad started our meal.  The super yummy cheesecake was on the house for first time customers.  Yes yes

Man what a trip this place was. Unfortunately for us, we got sat in the very back by the kitchen. The staff runs around like chicken with their heads cut off and are so far beyond unprofessional. Managers yelling everyone's business, I heard employees talking crap, and it was just all around one huge cluster F. The menu sounds good and is on the pricier side but I compared my dish to something I could find at like Chili's. I'm not quite sure how they have such a high rating, my experience was much less than satisfactory and I will never return.

I took my 20 year old daughter here while she was visiting from Florida. She is a real food nut like me and we both love to try places off the beaten path. What a pleasant surprise this place was. Everything, and I mean everything we ate was fantastic. 

I suggested a couple weeks later, to a group of business associates that we try it. They had never been, but they know how I love my food and how I don't just throw suggestions around. 7 of us went and I found that the first trip was no fluke. My team all agreed it was one of the best meals we had ever had. We ordered a ton of food in order to try as many dishes as we could. Everything was great. With many of them being described as the best thing they ever put in their mouth.

The service was excellent. The owner Tom, met me both times at he front door, with a warm welcome. Chef Al came over and visited with us for a while as well. Great Great Food. I'm planning on going every chance I get. It has spoiled me to many other "Famous" chefs and restaurants. this place is killer!

Although I like this place, I probably won't be going back! $13 for only TWO bacon wrap shrimps. Unbelievable! You can buy a whole bag of large size shrimp with 50 inside at the grocery store plus $4 for a pack of Bacon, make your own bacon wrap shrimp at home. I ordered thinking i was going to get at least 6/7 shrimp.

love this place! great food.....ordered 2 pastas dishes on 2 separate occasions and you can tell this place uses good quality ingredients...even if they don't they sure as hell fooled me!  Yes...I'm a fan!
Best food ever!!! Especially the chicken parm. My favorite restaurant. Great for family meals.

Amazing service and wonderful food. The best Italian food I've ever had. Ever. The atmosphere is laid back but the servers and chefs are the true gems at this location. Wonderful people that serve up wonderful items. I will be sharing this place with my family and friends and I will be back soon!!

My husband and I are always on the lookout for great places to eat at a reasonable cost.  Off the Strip totally delivered!  You do need a car to get there from the strip.  We are staying at the south end of the strip, so it was about a 10 minute drive - well worth it!  We went on a Monday evening and were seated immediately.  I was happy right away as my favorite wine was on the menu, which is unusual.  I started with the wedge salad (it was a special that day).  It was great!  So many wedge salads come with half a head of lettuce, a few bacon bits thrown on and some cheap nasty bleu cheese - not this one!  The lettuce wedge was the perfect size - not too big.  The bacon was freshly cooked, the dressing wonderful, and the presentation lovely with sliced tomatoes and green onions.  My husband had the house salad and he said it was good.  For dinner, I had the scampi stuffed chicken.  It was served over angel hair pasta with some kind of wonderful balsamic cream sauce.  I wanted to lick the plate, the sauce was so good.  The chicken was delicious - it looked like a plain chicken breast, but inside - the most delicious shrimp scampi (how did they get it in there?!).  My husband had the rigatoni bolognese; he added on the "softball" meatball.  Our daughter plays softball - he had to have it.  It really is a softball-sized meatball.  He was very happy with his food as well.  I did taste his rigatoni, and it was good (I preferred my own meal, however).  For dessert we had to try the famous cheesecake and it was excellent.  I enjoyed every bite!  Caution - it was quite rich, and the slice was big.  Easily shared between two.  

The atmosphere is casual and comfortable.  No fancy dress required, which I love!  Donna was our server, and she was great!  So friendly and gave me good recommendations and advice.  We enjoyed talking with her for a moment at the end of our meal.  The service from everyone was excellent - timed perfectly, drinks were refilled quickly.  We did not feel rushed, which I very much appreciated.

If you're in Vegas with a car, definitely go.  Better food than you'll find on the strip at a much better value!

This place is Amazing!!! My girlfriend and I wanted to try a new place for dinner that's close by the house. Let me tell you, the food was amazing and so flavorful! She had the Salmon and I had the Cajun Ribeye. Along with that we tried many other menu items and even the Cheesecake, and WOW it was delicious! 
To top it all off, Donna the GM took the best care of us while we had our dinner. She was the nicest, most pleasant and down to earth person! She was such a sweetheart and her service along the food was absolutely amazing! We will definitely be coming back here regularly!

Ordered a late lunch to go from here the other day; which was my first time trying their food. Both myself and my father in law ordered pasta dishes. The food was fantastic, and not only met our expectations but exceeded them. Our food was ready for me to pick up exactly in the time they said. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant and I am looking forward to eating there again.

Everyone is very friendly felt good to have people not in bad moods while taking care of us. I went there with my family. My husband had the linguine and clams, my daughter had the wings and i had the shrimp scampi. My husband said his linguine and clams wasnt very good. Too salty, and the garlic needed to be cooked down more because it was very potent in garlic taste. Also he said the clams were gritty with sand. My shrimp scampi was tasty yet i also have to say it was super garlicy. Seems as if they just use way too much garlic. Our server didnt bring us silverware until we asked, and he also forgot my husband coke until we asked. Wasnt the best service but i do admit the bartender behind the bar when we camr in was super helpful and friendly and even our server was friendly he just forgot stuff which does make a difference with service. We were here before and it seemed as if the service and food was better or maybe it was because we ordered different stuff this time. Its a decent locals spot however the garlic needs to be toned down or cooked longer.

Just a quick review about some take out Cheesecake from this place......
My husband and I went by this restaurant last night to try some of their cheesecake that we heard 'Is To Die For!'
We walked in and were greeted by the friendly bartender who told us for take out just go to the back where the cash register was and they could help us with our order.  
First off, the ambiance for this place is really nothing to write home about and is very boring.  So we weren't impressed with that aspect of it. Like I said before, the bartender was nice, but I can't say the same for the guy at the cash register!
He was rude.  No greeting, no smile, and seemed bothered that we were only ordering the Cheesecake to go.  We even told him that we heard that the cheesecake was 'To Die For', and he didn't even blink.....he took our payment and said, 'It'll be up in a minute'......
I wanted to come back at another time and try and entree or more, but not now.
Service is a HUGE part of a business, and the service here made this customer not want to ever come back to this place again. We also will not be recommending this place to any of our friends or family.....
As for the cheesecake.....My husband liked it, but I've had better!

One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!! The food, atmospheric, employees and owner.  Everyone is so nice & friendly.   My favorite dishes are the Thai bacon wrapped prawns and chicken and artichokes!!! So delicious. We go at least once a week!! Never a disappointment.  :)
It was our 1st time here.  Got there 5 minutes before Happy hour, she gave us time to order still got happy hour discount ! Food was great! Great service!

Good and tasty but service was TERRIBLE 

Tuesday night I had my best friend visiting from Chicago and I wanted to take her out to a cozy dinner and wine. Off the strip is near my house and I've heard amazing things about this place. 

The waiter took a while to get to our table and say hi, he took our drink order and turned around while we were still trying to order an appetizer. 
We had calamari (tasty)

He never brought us the complementary bread until I asked for it since I noticed all the other tables had bread. 

He never checked back on us until I waved him down (witch I hate to do)   
 
We both ordered all you can eat pasta(great deal) 

The food was amazing and the location is perfect for me but the service makes me not want to go back again :(
Delicious food. Laid back service. Come here if you want a long, leisurely dinner.
Will do a full reeview in the near future, but a Tip for you is for you come down and try it out.  I love this place

I took my father here for his birthday dinner. It is located in the Southern Highlands Shopping Center, close to my favorite tapas joint, Barcelona. We did our homework prior, perusing the menu beforehand. My parents and I were very excited.

From outward appearance, it doesn't look like much. The same goes for the interior. It isn't a fancy place and most people were dressed casually. There is a bar to the right and the dining area is to the left, with basic tables with tablecloths. A good sign is a packed house on a Thursday night at 7pm. We had just missed Happy Hour, unfortunately.

We were seated at a 4-person table in the corner. We had just settled in and were immediately greeted by our sever, Jesse. He was warm and jovial, already making us laugh as he took our drink order: Martini for my dad, Sangria for my mom, and a Cucumber Martini for me. The drinks were one of the things that were basic. Nothing special here.

After looking at the menu, we found more things we wanted to try. We started off with an appetizer: The Rolled New York. It was the perfect amuse bouche. The description, Choice Black Angus New York Strip cut thin and wrapped around grilled asparagus and provolone with basil and sun-dried tomatoes. Dressed with a Marsala mushroom sauce, was exactly that. I don't like steak and I enjoyed this.

For my entree, I got the Orange Roughy Franchese. Per description, 
Orange Roughy lightly floured and pan fried with white wine and shallots. Presented with lemon butter sauce over angel hair pasta. I had never had this fish before. It was cooked perfectly, flaky, and light. The sauce was delicious. An abundance of pasta with a great portion of the fish.

My mom got the Lobster Ravioli. Per description, Ravioli stuffed with lobster dressed with mushrooms and asparagus in a sauce of red ripe tomatoes, cream and shallots infused with vodka. One of the better ones I have tried. I good amount of lobster per portion. A very nice sauce complementing the pasta. She enjoyed her choice very much.

The birthday boy was excited to try the French Pork Chops. Per description, Grilled and baked pork chops topped with cream, bacon, mushroom, and wilted onion over mashed potato. I am so happy that my father absolutely loved his entree. He couldn't stop raving over it. He is difficult to please and had zero complaints. The piece I tried was so good. I agreed with him that he had the best entree amongst the 3 of us.

They are served with a side salad, a choice of house (lettuce mix with cucumbers and tomatoes in a balsamic vinigarette) or Caesar salad. Basic, nothing special here. Also were given bread (sliced italian bread) and butter. Again, basic, as it sounds.

Our server checked in with us throughout the meal. It was the perfect amount and he came to us quickly for drink refills. His only added to the wonderful dining experience. My dad loves to joke around and he was able to make us all laugh. 

The kicker at the end was the slice of cheesecake that was brought out with a candle for my dad. I didn't have to ask for it and it was a sweet surprise for my dad. The cheesecake itself was top notch. Beats Cheesecake Factory's Original (plain) Cheesecake. You can tell that it is made inhouse. Cheesecake is my father's favorite dessert. It was the perfect ending to a near perfect dining experience.

At the end of the evening, the owner approached us to ask about our meal. He was gracious, inviting us back to his establishment.

The overall dining experience was an A+ in my book. The prices were reasonable to me. However, I am use to L.A.'s exorbitant restaurant prices, so take my opinion as you will. To the casual diner, yes, this place is a tad pricey. However, you do get what you paid for. 

We are looking forward to taking my brother and his girlfriend the next time they come to visit. A dining gem in a shopping center. A great local business to support.

We live in Southern Highlands, but just discovered Zest last week. Boy, were we missing out on something good right there in our own backyard. The menu is large and has so many different types of food that they offer. So far, we have tried the Linguini with Clams, Flat Bread Pizza, Sliders and the Pesto Garlic Bread. They were all delicious! We cant wait to try other items on their menu. The service has been wonderful as well, including Miguel, who made a great Cadillac Margerita for my very particular wife.
Thanks Zest!
Jeff and Stacey

One of the better italian restaurants in vegas, off the beaten path from tourists visiting, but a nice gem for locals in southern highlands. As a native new yorker of italian heritage, i am ridiculously picky when dining at an italian joint, but zest is complaint free. Tasty, good portion dishes, extremely price conscientious, and the wait staff, especially Jesse, who has been my server the past two times, is beyond phenomenal. 10/10 place for a good italian meal, take a new york ginnys word for it and try it out.

Nothing fancy-pants about this restaurant but the incomparable personalized touch especially from the Chef and the Manager plus really good, unassuming food make Off the Strip - Just Real Food worth the drive! The appetizers are fabulous, especially the crab cakes (we used to reside in Baltimore so we'd like to think we know good crab cakes), the clams and the pork roulade.  The Beef Wellington is superb!  Go with an empty stomach!  Just go!
Haven't been here since they changed the name. So we stopped in to try it out . The service was good and the portions were big enough for two to share.

Even though I live nearby, this restaurant is worthy of being a destination restaurant. They make everyone feel welcome, and welcome back. My husband and I love this place. Tom and remembers his guests and knows just what to recommend on those indecisive nights. The service is great and the food causes cravings for more. The Wellington is superb and the spaghetti with softball meatballs is fantastic (especially for a to-go order since it's awesome the next day, too). Everyone comes out to say hi to our dog Bailey when we get food to go and it gives Off the Strip a community feeling. And for people wondering about the price: everything is worth more than every penny. The Wellington is the best one you will ever get for that price. And if you are on a budget, the meatloaf is inexpensive, filling, and super tasty. Or you can do your own meal out of some of the appetizers (shrimp scampi is great for a lighter dinner portion and the ribs are a meal). Other info: Chicken parm is big enough for two, the lobster ravioli is great, I never go there without getting the Rolled New York, and the beverage selection is always expanding. Get the cheesecake to go so you still get it, but have the time to digest dinner before hand.
Came here for a night out with my fiancé and coworker and loved the food. A little bit pricey but for the quality it's a great deal. I also love the vibe.

After reading all of the 5 star reviews and recommendations from friends, I have to say, we were very, very disappointed. Maybe it was just an off night. First, we weren't greeted when we walked in and had no idea if we were supposed to seat ourselves, or wait. Finally a man directed us to sit at a table only feet from the door, which was awkward. The food was highly disappointing. I asked if they had plain Mac and cheese for my daughter, noticing truffle Mac and cheese was on the menu. Response was no...which means they have a huge pot of "truffle Mac and cheese" sitting around in the back-gross. Instead they offered to make penne with a butter Parmesan sauce-which ended up being penne in a butter soup with some parm on top-double gross. I ordered the Wellington which was soggy and undercooked. My husband ordered the bacon wrapped steak which was overcooked. The only reason for the second star is because of our waitress who was very sweet and was clearly working her butt off. Too bad.
The best neighborhood restaurant and bar. The staff is beyond friendly. I can't say enough about this place!

We dined here for NYE. For NYE there was a special menu so I'll definitely have to come back in the future and try some items from the regular menu as well.

The location is interesting and probably not a location would be easy to stumble upon if you live somewhere other than Southern Highlands. My coworkers highly recommended this spot which is how I learned of this restaurant. Being in a shopping center does mean that there was ample parking and it was a quick walk from the car. 

I wasn't sure what the ambiance would be when looking at the menu versus knowing that it was in a strip shopping center. The menu lends itself to a fancier setting, but inside the restaurant is casual. To me it felt similar to the feel of a casual pizza spot. The good news is that you don't have to get dressed up for good food here.

We started with Crab Cakes and Short Rib Ravioli. The Crab Cakes were full of crab and well seasoned. The sauce on the crab cakes paired well with the crab flavor. Our waitress told us that these are made in house. The Short Rib Ravioli is made outside of the restaurant, but was delicious as well. The gravy like sauce on top paired well with short rib and the ravioli was a nice texture. We were also brought bread which was unremarkable and I'm not sure why they even bother serving it. It just didn't seem to be in line with the quality of the food here.

For the salad course we had a Greek Salad and a Wedge Salad. The Wedge Salad was good, but pretty standard. The Greek salad was a jazzed up version of the standard Greek Salad with plenty of feta and balsamic vinegar dressing.

For entrees we went with the Seafood Linguine Fra-Diablo and Prime Rib. For sides we opted for the Truffle Mac & Cheese and the Potato Au Gratin. The entrees and sides were all very generous portions. My husband enjoyed his seafood dish and the sauce on top. My prime rib was moist and had a nice herb flavor on the outside. The rarer parts had the best flavor. The Potato Au Gratin flavor was okay, but it was a bit dry and not the highlight. The Truffle Mac & Cheese was amazing. The truffle flavor was the perfect amount and I could eat this as an entrée. Loved this side!

Dessert was NY Cheesecake and Tiramisu. The NY Cheesecake is prepared in house and was very good. NY Cheesecake has a lovely, rich flavor. The chocolate on the side was delicious and could be enjoyed alone. The Tiramisu was probably the best I've ever had. It had more of an alcohol flavor than other tiramisus I've had, but it was done in a way that really enhanced the sweet instead of overpowering it.

The service was very good. My husband commented that he thought the service was up there with some of the best service we've had in town. Our waitress was friendly, attentive, and gave us a lot of good information about the food. They were also efficient at clearing dirty dishes and refilling drinks. 

They also offer take-out which is nice. We'll definitely be back to try some of the usual menu items or at least to grab some take-out for a night at home.

Best kept secret from Vegas Tourists.  Not only is the food here astounding and savory, but the service is something right out of New York City.  

Old world style conversation and treatment from the family of Off The Strip make it a place that is about more than the meal, its about having a night you remember for weeks to come!

This is really a great place! Vegas has lots of places to eat, but this is one you can't afford to miss! The food was absolutely awesome in every way. Far better than any celebrity chef chain restaurant on the strip. It had a very laid back atmosphere where you felt like you belonged. The staff was attentive and very friendly, even the owner came out to talk to us for a bit (great guy). By far this place is one of the hidden gems of Las Vegas. So if you want the true Vegas experience get Off The Strip!

Over priced, they play loud radio and the food is meh.  Spaghetti western is two doors down and much better.  Also who pays 36 dollars to sit at a sticky table and eat a pork chop.  Sorry I can eat at hundreds of places that are worth that price in atmosphere alone.  Only take a date here if you don't want to get laid.

FRESH calamari and the most awesome gravy ive had in a long time. Homemade cheesecake is light and creamy, not heavy and cakey. This place has something on the menu for everyone!

Open the door to this open-kitchen slash rustic-brasserie slash sports-bar slash italian eatery and you're instantly smacked with the delectable aromas of baked and stewed italian favorites.

Wins:
--awesomely fresh calamari app with the best tomato sauce (gravy) anywhere.
--homemade cheesecake for first-timers. Wowow.
--pasta was out of the world with moist perfectly-cooked chicken

But....
Ugh:
# caesar salad bland. Missing egg, lemon, cheese and anchovy. Don't call is a caesar.
# butter served in peel-your-own foil-and-plastic pad onesies.
# bacon-wrapped prawns swimming in generic sweet and sour gook. What a shame.
# steak-wrapped asparagus in marsala mushroom sauce overcooked and slimy. Too bad.
# filet mignon promised on menu as cut to order, but it was clearly not. Ive had better from the grocery manager-special clearance bin.
Veg was pitiful. Sliced zucchini bland and old. Barely tepid.
Plop of potato mash, bland, boring, almost cold.

Service hit or miss. Little coordination or communication, just lots of staff walking around doing something else besides serving.
Regular patrons get the attention.

It's been a while since I've updated and the food hasn't missed a beat! My new favorite is protein menu petite filet over pasta. I legit spoon up every last drop. I have recently tried cheese tortellini and it is so good. 

Also, the pizzas are out of this world. Billy's New York pizza and the donna are two of my absolute faves. They're delicious when I eat in, and even a few days later when I eat my leftovers from the fridge. 

The service and ambiance is always top notch and I just can't say enough great things!  
*they serve Mexican cokes which is always another plus. Brunch, delicious menu and bottomless bloody Mary's. All anyone needs on a lazy Sunday!

Great Experience and doing things right. Went there on a whim on a Wednesday night. Far drive (for us), but completely worth it.

Service Highlights
-We were greeted with a smile and acknowledged as soon as we entered even though it was busy and took a minute to be seated. 
-Ordered an unfamiliar bottle of beer and was immediately offered a replacement if I decided I didn't like it
-Extremely attentive and friendly staff
-After mentioning that I specifically took my friends here because I told them about the amazing cheesecake, it was given to us on the house


Food Highlights: 
-Huge delicious slices of both mozzarella and tomato on the Caprese Salad
-Homemade croutons on Caesar salad
-Eggplant Parmesan was served as a hearty portion, rounds layered like a lasagna and the best entree we had there
-Cheesecake. Apparently homemade. Creamy but not dense like many other places.Best I've had in Las Vegas. 

Atmosphere:
-Comfortable, dim, not too loud
-Open Kitchen, which is kind of cool


Con: Had leftovers and were given the take-out boxes to pack ourselves

Sauce and meatballs are tasty and made fresh.
I usually cook all these dishes at home but if im not cooking I would come here for sure.

There is no place my husband and I would rather go for a night out. The service is impeccable and the food is nothing short of amazing. Jesse and Donna are fantastic and practically the main reason we keep coming back!!

The cheesecake is super dank. If you were thinking about going and wasting your money at Cheesecake Factory you should think again and go to Zest. I'm gonna keep getting it every week till they quit giving me these fat delicious slices.

As a foodie, I often take my boyfriend on my food adventures to make sure we try some place new! Sometimes you find gems, but this place is ok for a quick lunch, but nothing special. It was moderately busy at night and rather a labyrinth to find through all the house tracks. 

The service was quick and polite but the food was sub-par. My boyrfriend ordered a steak that was supposedly marinated in cajun sauce for 3 days or something similar. There wasn't any flavor to it especailly being a $40 steak! I ordered the Shrimp Scampi which was ok. Honestly, I would of preferred Cheesecake Factory's version, which is way better!

Want flavors to make your tastebuds jump for joy? Pass on this place.
By far one of the best places i have ever been to!! the mussels are amazing as well as the sweet chili prawns!! great atmosphere, just real good food!!

My boyfriend and I found this restaurant through the Las Vegas Seven Magazine August 2011. Italian food isn't really our preference, but we tried this place for a change from the usual. 

The atmosphere is comfortable, cozy, & modern. The staff are very welcoming! Here is what we ordered:

Appetizer: 
Rolled NY - The steak was cooked perfectly with a great Marsala Sauce.

Salads: 
Caesar - sauce is not over powering with a hint of garlic, very good!
House - very fresh and tasty

Entree: 
Rigatoni alla Vodka w/ chicken - The sauce is better than Brio's Pasta alla Vodka. I could taste the tomatoes and the cream is not overwhelming. I asked to add chicken. I don't recommend it, because the pasta is good by itself. My chicken was on the salty side.

Chicken Tristina - Very delicious! the chicken was juicy and the sauce was light and fresh, a great compliment to the veggies and chicken. 

Did not have any desert because we were so full! The portions are generous. Everything tastes home-made and made daily. Staff appreciate's your business. I'd give it a 5 star if my chicken wasn't as salty. I'd come here again and recommend it to a friend.

My wife and I ate here under the former name and we agree with the lower ratings. It's simply not the quality of food that we want to see in such a competitive area such as Las Vegas even though "off strip".  Based on reviews of the food not improving with the new name we won't be trying again.

We've order the salmon and brown rice 3 times thru UberEats.  The first time everything was delicious!!  This was on the 12-16.  We ordered again on 12-19 and everything was delicious except the brown rice which was half cooked.  We thought it was a just a one time thing since Zest has always been great.  We thought we would try again so we ordered it again for the third time last night 12-21.  Once again, everything was great except the brown rice was half cooked again.  It may be that there is a difference person cooking the rice and they hit the wrong setting on the rice cooker?  Brown rice takes much longer than white rice to cook.

I would first off like to thank Donna who was our server this evening for her exceptional service! This was our first visit ever to this establishment. Not only did Donna welcome us as first time diners, she made our first visit special. I was speculative of such high priced items like the beef Wellington being served in an environment that made me feel like I was in any typical bar. Originally I had low expectations going into this place.. but I left with feeling very satisfied by the food and service. Donna truly made our experience one to remember, and we will be back because of her. 

And the delicious food. :-P

Thanks Billy and team!   As always great food, I absolutely love that you do UberEats!  Just got home from a trip, too tired to cook or go out, want excellent food......I'll order from Zest!!! 

Lisa and Ken
This place is great. Wonderful food and great service . Nicole our server was the best. This was our first time here and we will be back.

Excellent food, service and decent prices for what you get. I have been here twice and have not been disappointed. 
On my last visit, I had just gotten out of the hospital and needed to eat and was desperately craving..."REAL GOOD HEARTY FOOD"!!! I hit the nail in the head with this place!! I had the special of the day which was Mahi-Mahi in a Thai chile lime sauce, served with fire roasted grilled veggies and a fluffy wild rice pilaf with a nice glass of Chardonnay. The fish was fresh & the veggies were not soggy. My meal ended with a slice of their decadent cheesecake and a rich n bold cup of coffee!! Not bad for under $45dllrs for all including tip!!

Visited here Saturday night and it was so good. The lobster ravioli and shrimp scampi were amazing. Stephanie provided the best service I've come across in awhile.  It was fun, fantastic food and awesome service.... however the very best thing is their homemade cheesecake... wow!! Thank you Stephanie for a great experience.
I have never been to a better place in my life. The salmon platter bomb.com. Donna, the owner was so nice! James, our server, was on point; never let our glasses run dry!

More of a three and half star, but I can't do it so they got the benefit. It was a slow night and they were already out of two dishes that I wanted to try out which was odd for an earlier weekend night. The atmosphere doesn't match the higher prices on the menu. The food quality was good as expected but not amazing. The service on the food coming out was slow and there were not many customers at the time. However, I would go back though to tryout other things on the menu

Awful coffee, terrible service, mediocre food. We had 'brunch' not sure what their dinners or cocktails are like. I'm pretty sure most of their business is because the wait at Rise and Shine next door is too long (how I ended up here). You can't call yourself a bistro and have terrible drip coffee. Maybe the fresh pot was better but I couldn't get the waiters attention for about 15 minutes at a time so I wasn't in the mood for trying more. I suggest trying somewhere else instead- signed, a Las Vegas local.

This place is amazing! I have eaten here about a dozen times and I am never disappointed. The food is always great and always consistent. They also have an amazing beef Wellington I highly recommend. OTSJRF is popular so don't be surprised if there is a wait, but it's well worth it.

We usually plan our trip to LV around the day we get to eat here at zest. Normally our waitress is Stephanie and she is the best, but tonight sadly she didn't happen to work but we were served by Zack, who was super attentive, positive, and got everything perfect while making sure we had a great experience. We all ordered the shrimp scampi stuffed chicken which is the greatest dish I've ever had, but understanding that good food done right might take a bit longer, we were super impressed with Zack, who made sure he gave us updates and made sure we knew exactly how long it would take and made sure we were taken care of very well. Sure enough everything was perfect and delicious. I got to meet and talk to the owner, Billy who made sure to talk to each and every one of his customers. This is by far my favourite place to eat here in Vegas and I often find myself really thinking about the food months before I get out here. If you haven't tried this place, you really need to as soon as you can, I guarantee you will have a new fav place.
Living in SouthernHighlands, we have limited options. This place is okay, over priced and sometimes they use to much garlic.

Off The Strip is an excellent local spot. Always busy. The team there is really nice and ultra attentive to your wants. I would highly recommend it to anyone. There are some great dishes, but sometimes may be a little too saucy or flavorful. I love flavor, don't get me wrong, but you can leave there feeling a little rough if you mix too many things and I love to try alot of things when I eat. Don't let those thoughts stray you from exploring. This place is a definite favorite of mine still.

On both of our visits, we were accompanied by another couple. The first time, they both us and the second time, we returned the favor and brought another couple. Both visits were very pleasant. The first time had to be 1-2 years ago because it was before the expansions, which are very nice! Anyway, the food is great, but nothing really stands out as spectacular. 

On our last visit, we started with the garlic bread as an appetizer. Our server warned us that it was very garlicky, which we appreciated, but didn't mind and it was good. Something you would make at home on Spaghetti Night. We all ordered Caesar salads with our entrees and were, again, warned of its extreme garlic nature. Even with the forewarning, it didn't prepare me. It was really, really, REALLY overwhelming and as much I truly love garlic, I couldn't even finish the small salad. It was way too much. Next time, I'll order the dressing on the side. For entrees, I had the Spaghetti alle Vongole, one of my pasta favorites and Italian restaurant go-to menu items. The garlic wasn't as overwhelming in this dish, but certainly strong (I wasn't warned this time). The clams were chopped up and muddled with the large slices of garlic - I am not a fan of this preparation (I'd prefer the clam still in their shells). However, it was still very tasty and I did enjoy my dinner. 

Someone in our party had an issue with their entree and the situation was handled very awkwardly. The server removed the dish, but didn't mention anything else about it. It seemed more like a misunderstanding and in the end, I felt it was handled well with removing the entree from our bill and delivering a complimentary slice of their housemade NY-style cheesecake. If anything brings me back to the restaurant, it would be this magnificent cheesecake (and the service!). It is SOOO delicious. It's served with caramel, chocolate, and strawberry sauce and it's just perfect. The cake itself is soft, moist, and not dense like most cheesecakes, the crust was scrumptious, and the side sauces added your own flair per bite! 

Anyway, service was wonderful and I love the casual, but elegant atmosphere. It's also great to not have to go anywhere near The Strip (haha)! Oh, and we also really enjoyed their Riesling selection (Starling Castle).
Great neighborhood restaurant that's not in a casino. Would go back and recommend. Had the lamb chops and it was delicious!

If you are looking for quantity over quality, then this is the place for you.  Portion sizes are ridiculously large and had I known that I would have split an entree with the boyfriend.  Food quality is just ok, nothing that would make me seek out this place a second time.  The house salad and the cheesecake were the standouts of the meal.  The chicken tristina was swimming in some sort of flavorless watery sauce and the chicken parm pasta was not good.
Amazing service and some great just down to earth food! Excellent menu and superb service! Donna had our drinks ON POINT the whole night. Definitely one of the great neighborhood places!
Great food and drinks and near by. Donna is incredible!  Would be cool if we could get one of the TV's tuned to Bravo . Always a pleasure to drop in.

My friend and I had been wanting to try this place out and finally we did 2/6/17 and boy it was AHHHMAZING!!! Food is prepared superb!!! Ordered Clam Chowder and it tasted HEAVEN!! My friend ordered Truffle Fries and it was yhe best Truffle Fries I've ever had, not soaked in oil or overwhelmed with cheese and salt..just cooked perfectly! They also have lots of healthy food choices and huge menu selection! I highly recommend to try this place!! It is very clean and service is EXCELLENT! I shall be coming back often!!! I might add the GM Donna was great!!!!

My BFF drags me here like twice a week & i must say I like it. the portions are huge, the food is delicious and the service well its just "special"... special in a good way.  Quaint little cozy spot to "tie one on" and stuff your face with lovely strip quality dishes :)

After searching on Yelp on where to eat tonight, we chose this Off the Strip because of the chicken wing reviews.
We arrived there and I ordered the Sea Bass and my husband, the pork chops.  Both entrees came with a green salad with balsamic vinaigrette or Caesar salad - both salad dressings were home made.
Both the entrees and salads were delicious.  The pork chops were crusted after marinated in papaya and cherry wine which made then very tender.  Pan fried peppers and mushrooms covered the chops. The sea bass was in a white wine sauce with sauteed cabbage/peppers/carrots which was an odd combination but very tasty!  The potatoes on both entrees were seasoned, crusted and not overbearing.
The very creamy cheesecake was a great ending!  I also loved the crusty bread.
We were very satisfied and will be going there again.
Atmosphere was very relaxing with TV's showing the NBA Final.
Donna at the bar was amazing! Came in stuffed but we enquired about the food and she brought out a ramekin sample of the mashed potatoes annnnd  sold! Cant wait to come back! Great service

The food is good but bartender is a rude person, sitting at the bar every time she tosses a bottle in the trash everyon jumps. Asked her to please set the bottles in the trash and she gave a mad look and said sure as she smashed another Bottle. I walked out after that. Mean old woman

Sat at the bar this evening winding down after a long day. Donna was my bartender and was nothing short of exceptional! Her attentiveness was on point regardless of the locals who obviously adore her and her professionalism. She tented to each person as if they where all repeated customers.   I will certainly return and I look forward to bringing my dear friend here when she visits next week! Five stars on guest service! Thank you Donna personally, I look forward to visiting you again next week! - Ronnie
I can't say enough about this place. The service is excellent and the food is always exceptional.  If you can on Friday's make sure to try the crab cakes! Always a great experience at Zest.

Don't know why it took me so long to try this place out. The name doesn't do much to catch your attention,  but the ratings were enough to get me in the door. Right off the bat, the service was great. They seated us quickly and were extremely patient with us when we were looking over the menu. Ordering the lobster ravioli was the best decision we could've made. Everything we ordered was packed with flavor. Even the fresh bread that they brought out before dinner was great. We had such a wonderful experience. Great service, great food, AND right in the hood?! SOLD! Can't wait to go back. So glad that we have this gem in Southern Highlands. I have a feeling this will become a regular spot for us now.
Love the lemon piccata! Easy to get In, friendly staff and great food. Not a fan of the pizza but have tried several dinners that were all delicious.

All I can say is Yummmmmm! Fantastic food! Decent wine selection. Great service. Locally owned!
I had some crazy good food here. Asparagus wrapped up with thnly sliced filet Mignon and some of the most flavorful Rigatoni Bolognese I have ever had! Cheesecake was ridiculously delicious... There is more much more you cant go wrong here.
Its not a fine dinning atmosphere and far from stuffy. Id say Vegas casual. And it was fun!

Not sure where to start.  I enjoyed everything about this place.

OTS is located in a mini mall in the back of a large parking area, with other stores and shops.  When you walk in, there is a nice bar to the right, which looks like it is bigger than the dining area. TV's everywhere.  In fact, if I lived in the area, I would frequent this place often.  It is simply a very nice place.

Jack walks up and takes my drink order and introduces himself.  We have a nice talk, he tells me he is originally from the North Hollywood, CA area, near my home. I ordered by taking my cue from their specials menu.  I went with the Lobster and Pasta, linquini.  This thing was so freaking good.  Some of the best lobster I have ever had.  Succulent lobster and the pasta was just right.  He brought me bread that I filled up on, which made it difficult to finish my meal.  

So I am sitting there letting my stomach recover, watching a ball game or two, and Jack presents me with a large piece of cheesecake, on the house.  I was stunned.  And yes, this cheesecake was absolutely delicious and yes, some of the best I have ever had.  Great taste, great crust on the bottom.  Wow.

I told Jack that, yes, the food was great, the service was great and the place was nice.  But better than anything, I told him he made me feel like a friend.

Don't expect to get free cheesecake when you go here. But expect great food, great service and great people.  

He asked me to tell my friends.  Well, I consider my fellow Yelpers to be my friends.  So I am telling you all, go here.  It is a little off the beaten path.  But worth it.

And Jack, thanks buddy. Best of luck to you.  I shall visit you again when in town.

I've never been to a restaurant where EVERYTHING was good. Usually you get some specialties that are the thing u always goto that restaurant for. Zest is the one place i have been where thats not the case. When i say everything, they have the best beef stroganoff i've ever had. The Cheesecake is made from scratch and the best i've ever had. Sunday is Prime Rib special, you simply must try it. These days i try to eat a bit more healthy and even the Salmon with Asaparagus is simply stellar. 

They other thing thats so important about having a great restaurant is the staff. They make you feel like family, they remember what you like to drink, how you like your food, all the little things that make a customer feel special and make them a customer for life. Once you come here you will be one as well.

HIGHLY recommend. I eat here all the time and will forever.

Oh my goodness the minute we sat down at the bar for happy hour, Donna took care of us straight away! The atmosphere is relaxing and friendly! She brought us our drinks right away and the food was amazing as well! We can't wait to come back for taco Tuesday!

Found this place while driving by. The food was Aaaahhhh-mazing! The customer service was great aswell. The waitress was very helpful recommending food. I would definitely recommend checking this spot out!
I wrote a review 6 months ago.. But we are back for our fourth visit and I absolutely love this place! The best service ever! Plus they love garlic like i do:) Donna and Rick are fabulous!

I have to admit, when it comes to restaurants that have really high rating from customers, I generally read the reviews of those who rated it the lowest.  Certainly not the popular way of taking in all the reviews but constant raves have far too often set me up for disappointment.  In the case of Off The Strip, I wanted to know why the few bad reviews were written.

Having read the reviews, mostly bad, I decided to give Off The Strip a try because it was basically walking distance from our house.  I have to say that I really didn't share ANY of the bad opinions that have been shared here.

I and my family loved the food, environment (reminded us of authentic family owned Italian restaurants back home in NY) and the service.  Jack was incredibly attentive and inviting and was so gracious to invite us back to the restaurant even after the kitchen is closed to enjoy wine and music.

Being that we are from NY, good Italian is near and dear to our hearts.  Especially a good creamy vodka sauce and fried calamari.  The vodka sauce is quite possibly the best I have outside of Neo Posto and the now close Rigatoni, both in NY.  The calamari was light and flavorful, and everything we look for in that appetizer.  All the dishes around were something to savor and truly enjoy, not just satisfy.

Now if you have read this far you might be wondering why I did not give Off The Strip a perfect 5 stars.  My one issue about the restaurant was the prices.  The prices as they are, are by no means over the top or unreasonable.  But, they are at a level that makes Off The Strip more an indulgence eatery over a frequent dinner spot.  The food was just as good as I remembered back in NY, but the prices were $5 - $10 more.

I really like Off The Strip and will definitely be heading back again.  Unfortunately it won't be as often as we would like.

This place is awesome! The service was very quick. All you can eat and drink. Was in town for the day and was looking for a Bloody Mary restaurant. The server James was great and was very professional. Got all of our drinks and was very prompt to our request. The manager Donna even came over to say hi and check in on us. She was very sweet and you could see she cared for the business. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a chill spot. Good drinks, great food, and awesome service. Will be coming back when I'm in town next time.

We had heard great things about this place, and decided to give it a try last night. I have mixed feelings. I would recommend this place to people looking for a nicer, going out kind of restaurant. It's not the casual Sunday Dinner place we were expecting from a strip mall restaurant. 

Service - EXCELLENT!! Our server was attentive, The manager stopped by a few times to say hello and check on us. Our soda never went empty. 

Food - Decent, but everything we ordered had WAY too much garlic. We ordered the pesto garlic bread, and it came out more like a pizza - delish (we expected this to have garlic obviously). We both got caesar salads - too much raw garlic in the dressing, so much that it burned a little. I got the Chicken Saltimboca - again too much garlic, and too much salt. Made me drink a lot more water. It wasn't horrible, but I would have liked a lighter hand. My man got the Chicken Parm, and he said the sauce had too much garlic as well. We left with AWFUL breath, and we both are the kind of people that normally LOVE garlic, so it was kinda weird. 

Price - A tad overpriced. For an appetizer (the cheapest one they had), and 2 entrees, and 2 sodas (no alcohol) our final bill was $80 (with tip). WAY too much in my opinion for a strip mall restaurant. The food was good, but should have been closer to $14-16 instead of the $19-22 we paid. They also had lamb, and steak for $32+!! Was expecting to pay closer to $50, so it was a little bit of a let down. 

We will probably be back, but maybe only when we feel like splurging. Southern Highlands really needs a good all american restaurant with decent pricing that can be a regular spot. Was hoping that this would be it, but it's definitely not.

This place is just amazing.  The food, atmosphere, and service were just awesome.  I was a bit worried while I walked in because of how many people were inside and was thinking that it would take forever to get our order.  I was wrong.  Everything was swift.  Great place, and I would definitely come back here on a regular basis!

Went tonight for the first time with a group of 6. I had never been in there. Its Italian, seafood and steaks. It's a casual atmosphere with really great food. There is a bar area and some seating and on the other side with more tables. Saw lots of to go orders and to go pizzas. Service was outstanding and everyone in our group loved their entrees. Good bread and salads too. Will be returning very soon! Hidden gem.

Get in your rental car and head to Off The Strip! 

Excellent informal attentive service. You are taken care of like you're a guest in their house. 

Food was spot on and perfectly prepared. It is so NOT of the over-rated, foo foo celebrity chef, on-the-strip culinary genre. Just good food done well. 

As far as price... well I don't know. My friend won at the blackjack table and picked up the tab for the table. :)

SOOooooo, I waited to write a review to make certain it wasn't the hunger, and I can say that this place was down right tasty! Certainly a great find and has so much to offer. Called in 20 minutes before closing and they agreed to cook food for pick-up. (Missed the delivery cut-off time). One of the owners greeted us and was really nice. The place had a cool vibe, w/tv and great music. Wish we could have stayed to dine-in.

Ordered: 
Grilled Asparagus - was cooked just right. Still had a crispness to it, and seasoned perfectly. 

Crab Cakes - shredded crab NOT lump crab. They could have used a bit more flavor, but they decent in size. Just didn't have the tastiness for me to  rave about it. 

Scampi Stuffed Chicken-  OMG!!! So, the best of 3 worlds. Pasta, chicken, and shrimp. Very tasty, cooked to perfection, and juicy. Only downside was that in the take-out order it was one small stuffec chicken and an entire tray of paste. Not certain if dine-in would have given more or appeared to be balanced in portion. 

Grilled Salmon - Cooked just right. Has a nice zesty kick on a bed of rice. Very tasty.
